description:
Yukol is my neighborhood Thai takeout place. They're always super nice and on time with pickup orders. The spring rolls are delicious, and I usually either get pineapple fried rice or pad see ew with tofu. 

Note: Pad See Ew is not on the menu, but they can definitely make it for you!
author: Alison Y.

description:
We stopped by randomly on a Tuesday night. The food was delicious and the service attentive. We had #19, chicken and prawns with mushrooms and bell peppers, a curry dish with beef, and shared a soup. All that plus a side of rice and a Thai beer added up to $47. 

The most memorable part was when our waitress said she'd worked there since she was 15. I'm guessing that was almost 20 years ago. Astonishing. Impressive. I hope this means they treat the employees well!
author: Kristen S.

description:
My sister from NY was Airbnb-ing it in the area and decided to give this place a try since my niece is a huge Thai fan. Flash forward one year and countless visits from both my NY local Bay Area family and let's just say we go out of our way to eat here as much as we can! For appetizers we order the Poh Pier Tod #1, the Garden Rolls #14, the Satay #2, and the Katong Thong #8. Honestly, we could probably get full of these appetizers and end our day BUT their dishes are to die for too. Our go to dish every time we visit is the #21 Pad Kee Maou and ask for it medium spicy or spicy if you yourself is feeling spicy! For the less adventurous, #37 is essentially a Thai dish similar to Beef and Broccoli and tasty as well. 
Honestly, you can't go wrong at this place...plus the waiters and waitresses are so kind and helpful with suggestions based on what you like and don't like!
author: Vanessa O.

description: My hubby and I had dinner at this place since it was within walking distance of our hotel when we stayed in the city for a couple days.  We came around 6 and it was not crowded yet and very small and cute.  We order the following #9 angel wings, #37 Chinese w broccoli with beef and # 68 assorted veggies pineapple tofu tomatoes in sweet and sour sauce song with some steamed rice.  The chicken wings came out and it was stuffed with something but wow I really liked it and I liked all the veggies and noodles it came with. I have to admit when our main entrees came out we practically devoured the Chinese broccoli with beef dish. I so would come back for just that alone!  The sweet and sour dish was just ok to me as I felt like it was too sweet for me but I still ate it. Our waitress always kept our glasses of water topped off and she checked on us just enough too. We ended up sharing dessert with was fried banana and coconut ice cream!  Wow that dish was more than enough for the both of us and the best way to end a good dinner too.  I definitely will be back to this place if ever in the area again.  Oh and as we were finishing up the crowd started coming in as well as lots of to go order pickups around 7 as it starts to get noisy and crowded.
author: Tanya M.

description: They refuse to take my order I'm not sure why call me back said it's 20 bucks for something that is clearly not there's something wrong with this place
author: Bobbi G.

description:
A fun dinner outing after a day of tailgating/bar hopping in the marina

Prices are fair
Portions are good
Flavors are robust 
Variety is definitely not a problem

Overall Thoughts

Would come back the next time I was in the area and needed a bite
author: Eddie W.

description: Yukol is the best thai food I have had hands down ever. I don't even like Thai food and this place has me addicted. The spring rolls are fresh. The yellow curry is divine. Tom Kha soup is awesome. Their rice could be slightly better but Im not complaining.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Randomly decided to try this place out and was surprisingly surprised my how good everything was! When we walked in on a Saturday night the restaurant was empty but we decided to try it anyways. We noticed a lot of pick up orders and soon after it began to fill out. Im glad we decided to stay and try it out. Probably my favorite Thai spot in SF. 

Highly recommend:
- Tom yum seafood soup- sweet, spicy and sour with bold flavors and lots of shrimp and mushroom
- Roti and curry dipping sauce- almost pancake like roti with a good crispy to the bite, curry sauce was delicious and had some bits of meat and potato. We had to ask for a second sauce bowl because it was so good!
- grilled pork with house made spicy sauce - the pork was thinly sliced and grilled perfectly but the sauce was the home runner!
author: Judy N.

description:
I can't believe this place is not on my radar. It's located on a weird stretch of Lumbard so it's not very busy, but the food here is excellent. We started with the appetizer special, the you and me. It's basically a fried spring roll that's wrapped in steamed rice roll. The texture is amazing and the filling is flavorful. It's definitely a must order. 

I got the pad Thai while my friend the pad see ew
- both were very good. There's plenty of meat and tofu in my dish. 

I can't wait to come back and try their other dishes. The service was attentive and our water was filled regularly. Me like!
author: Alice W.

description: Best Thai food in SF! We order from Yukol at least once a week. Friendly service and delicious food. Highly recommend!
author: Kelly K.

description:
Yukol Place is my go-to Thai spot in San Francisco. Trust me, I have tried the green curry at pretty much every place north of Market. The green curry comes piping hot (this is really important to me), great spicy heat (pretty spicy, but not uncomfortable), and the chicken is high quality. I have tried with beef too and would probably get it again. 

Other things I have had:

The #62 soup - it's delicious, but I think it was a bit lemony for me or maybe was too much salt. Hard to tell - I give it a 3/5 and worth trying if you love Thai soup, but not something I would order over the pad see ew or the green curry. 

Pad See Ew - not on the menu, but it's a classic Thai dish that they can make and it's also the best in the city (my opinion). I have had the green curry and pad see ew at Lemongrass and it's just not quite on the same level as Yukol Place. 

Great wait staff that pours you enough Thai Tea to put you in the stratosphere. Ambiance in there is very old school zen. 

P.S. if you google some of the top Thai places in SF, you'll come across Kin Khao which is delicious, but I waited over an hour and every dish was over $25. It's not somewhere I would rush back to. However, if you don't mind spending a little extra and you can get a reservation on open table, you will enjoy, but I don't think it's better than Yukol. Yukol is much more traditional and it's everything you want in a Thai restaurant.
author: Ryan A.

description:
After a great Yelp Elite event on Wed. night I decided to grab some late night eats near my house and was "feelin" some noodles. I'd never been to Yokol before but, have driven/walked past it a million times so I figured why the heck not. My order was pretty close to their "quittin time" so, I took my food to go and ate at the neighboring bar, Monohans. 

My order (chicken pad thai, cucumber salad) took all of 5 mins to prep (one of the many reasons I love Thai food) and it was piping hot when I opened it. I started with the salad and found their traditional dressing to be pretty good. Let's be honest, it's sugar, vinegar, and lime juice. Yum. The pad thai was cooked really well and the noodles were really comforting. I'm usually not a huge fan of tofu but, that was also solid. I'm aware that pad thai is probably the most "gringo" order at a Thai restaurant but, it's an easy go to and tough to screw up. 

All in all, it's a good option for cheap eats in the Marina area. I believe my total bill was around $15 bucks, so you can't beat that. The service was friendly and seems like it's a family run spot. I'll be back...
author: Benjamin F.

description: Thai food here is amazing and authentic, I got take out from here that took a little longer than expected but totally worth it! Service was great and all the staffs we dealt with were super friendly. Food is reasonably priced and portioned. Atmosphere was calm and inviting, definitely would come again for a sit down!
author: Dara P.

description: Some of the best Thai I've had in the city. Kind service, warm atmosphere. Will definitely return
author: Jesse T.

description:
The food was good,but not the best Thai... the House of Thai was amazing!!! I ordered 4 dishes and it came out to be over $60.  Not worth trying this place again...  like I said, after eating at The House of Thai, it's hard to beat that place!  I am Asian so I know my Asian food! 

-papaya salad was pretty good here. 
-pad se ew, just ok... had it better in other places
- soup, meh
- brown rice... weird bore. Rice that I was charged $5
-duck, good but small portion for the price. 

Overall the portions doesn't add up to the cost of their dishes and it kind of lacks authentic taste.  Go to House of Thai!  Food is amazing and not overly price.
author: KendraHA B.

description: The best Thai place I've had in San Francisco so far. The food is sophisticated and one notch above your regular Thai restaurant. Fresh ingredients and good service. This restaurant is a little gem in the neighborhood. It is usually not very crowded and seating is quick. Furthermore, they do delivery for $1 if you live close by. Highly recommend!
author: Sugar S.

description: Great Thai food and very friendly staff. The green curry is fantastic, as is the pad kee mao.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
We ordered take out last night and the food was fantastic.
VERY flavorful  I would give five stars but the website needs work and when we ordered, i learned there were other options that I didn't see online. But the food was delicious and the guy on the phone was helpful and courteous. We will definitely order from here again.
author: susan a.

description:
Only live three blocks away and have never been. It was terrific. It was very tasty and good. Great service. I had an entree, brown rice and a beer and it came to $22.00

I will definitely go back.
author: Tom T.

description:
Very good restaurant ! 
The waitresses are more than nice. I spent two nights in SF and we ate there every dinner.
author: Léa C.

description: We were a party of 11 on a busy Saturday evening and the service was fantastic, and the food absolutely delicious! Nice wine and beer selection as well. Thank you Yukol Place!
author: Monique H.

description: One of my favorite Thai places in SF. The red curry is my goto dish and if you're carbo-loading go for the Roti bread too. The staff here are among some of the nicest people.
author: Marwan M.

description: Great Thai Food in Cow Hollow neighborhood... SF Marina area.  Nice place, great service.
author: F A.

description: Simply fabulous.  Thank you for being open and feeding us so well late on a Friday night!
author: Ali L.

description:
THE BEST THAI FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD in my life yet!!

On one of my last days in San Francisco, I was getting a little homesick and a little worn from walking, traveling, and etc. I decided to go for the Thai restaurant right next to my hotel on Lombard Street, and I am sooo happy that I did!!

We first received a complimentary salad - I loved the slightly sweet vinaigrette on it!! It was a very simple salad with nuts, but the vinaigrette made it special.

I also had the You and Me Spring Rolls! This is very, very similar to a dim sum dish in which basically a steam roll skin is wrapped outside of a regular spring roll. This gives more texture/distinction with the soft and fluffy skin of the steam roll and the crunch of a spring roll! I would say that this is one of the must-trys, although a little bit pricy for what it is.

Another appetizer we had is the duck larb (cooked in chilli pepper, onions, fresh mint leaves, and lime dressing with a touch of rice powder). Oh my, this is probably one of the best dishes I have ever had in my life. The duck skin was crispy, crunchy, and the meat was incredibly tender. The dish was just full of herbs, spices and was savory - a true appetizer in the sense that it completely "open your stomach and appetite." This is a must try from this restaurant.

I also ordered the Tom Yum Goong (Spicy and sour prawn soup with mushroom, onion, lemongrass, slices of tomatoes and lemon leaves). This was very surprising because I was expecting the thick, coconuty type of soup base, but this is very light and without the coconut flavor. It still retained the spicy and sour essences of Thai food.

On top of the food, the service was excellent. I felt like I was having a three course meal with the server bringing salad, appetizer, and then entrees out timely.

I want to go back to San Fran to go to this place again :(
author: Sophie C.

description:
Searching for dinner before our movie we picked this restaurant based on previous Yelpers. Could not have been happier we did. 

Service was amazing, friendly and prompt. The restaurant was nicely decorated, very clean, and extremely well-kept given the building age. 

Food was fab-u-lous. We had the Panang Chicken Curry and Chili Garlic Beef - housemade chili sauce is a must try. Presentation, prep, and quality was amazing -very apparent it was all made from scratch with fresh ingredients.
author: Jocelyn R.

description:
A friend and I were craving Thai so we decided to give this place a try. To sum it up, food was 3 stars but service was 5.
The pad thai was prettily presented and our food came out quickly, which was important because we were famished. But my dish, #20, was flavored like a garlicky diluted ketchup and the chicken was a bit dry. I would recommend trying a different dish.
author: Tina K.

description: Highly recommend. Satay and a shrimp appetizer was great. Service was great. Food was fresh and delicious.
author: D C.

description: Super fast delivery + ah-mazing food! My favorites are pumpkin curry with vegetables and their crispy egg rolls. I could eat these two for the rest of my life!!
author: Hande D.

description: Very good service and food. Setting is very nice and relaxing. Love the beef satay, the fish cakes, and the cashew chicken. Not very crowded but lots of take out orders. Many other restaurants could learn from the attentive and friendly service offered at this place.
author: R T.

description:
I hated to be one of those last minutes customers coming in before closing time. But I was one of them yesterday night. Thankful that they welcomed us in without hesitation. 

I ordered a Beef Pad Krapao with a side of rice. Loved the way the beef tasted with the sauté sauce. It comes mildly spicy (although I would want it extra spicy but my fiancé can not handle any sort of spice) but it tasted good nonetheless! And of course we had to try their Pad Thai too. Loved how it was a great sharing portion and importantly, it tasted amazing! The waitresses were extremely nice. Loved the atmosphere inside. I would definitely come back to try other things on the menu, but not near closing hours next time lol.
author: Kim F.

description: Good option whenever looking to get diner on a busy night without reservations anyplace else.  Food is consistently good and service even better.  While not the best Thai  I have had it is definitely acceptable.  Spring Rolls where made in house (amazing how often they are not, be sure to always ask).  We didn't have desert but they did have several interesting options which for some reason surprised us.
author: Nick T.

description:
Yukon Place Thai was very good. The waitresses were very attentive and accommodating. I love Thai food and the aromas of the spices but unfortunately I can't hang...  the waitress made sure to have the kitchen prep our order with milder spice. The dishes came out with the perfect amount of spice that I can tolerate but I was still sweating and had to take mini breaks. 

I have been craving egg rolls so my friend and I ordered #1 which had shrimp, ground pork, silver noodles and veggies. They served them on a bed of shredded cabbage and carrots with sweet chili sauce. It definitely fulfilled my cravings. We also ordered the coconut milk and chicken soup which has mushrooms, ginger and lemongrass served in a clay pot. The coconut soup broth was smooth in texture and was so flavorful. My friend had been craving green curry which we also requested on the milder side. She loved it. I had a couple bites and it was delicious. 

Thank goodness mangoes are in season. For dessert we ordered the sticky rice w mango and a scoop of coconut ice cream. Best ever! We wanted a tub of their coconut ice cream. It wasn't too sweet and had little shreds of coconut meat. Yummy. The mango and sticky rice was warm not to sticky. I'm craving for some now... 

We definitely will be coming back.
author: Annie V.

description: High quality Thai food and wonderful attentive service as well. It was a very comfortable and enjoyable atmosphere to sit in- quiet and a bit of respite from the city but still a bunch of other people there for a social vibe. The curry was delightful. Hits the spot if looking for solid Thai in a expected "old school" Thai restaurant vibe.
author: J K.

description:
Food is too authentic for me. Not for everyone. Fish oil is used in almost all dishes. 

The merits 
Quiet ambiance 
Polite waitresses 
Dimly lit romantic aura about the place 
Not crowded
author: Vaishnav D.

description: From bottom left to right: pad Thai, beef with cabbage and peanut sauce, green curry with chicken. AMAZING, delicious food! Great service too!
author: Cathryn C.

description:
I rarely write reviews for restaurants but Yukol has gone above and beyond in service, friendliness and damn good Thai food. 

Have dined in and ordered delivery/ take-out several times . The ambience of the restaurant is as many have described: comfy, warm and inviting. The entire staff is very well versed on the menu items, the food is authentic and fresh and the service is fast and inexpensive for the zip code. This is probably my highest ranked favorite neighborhood spot for great take-out. 

Tom Kha Gai is rich and creamy and full of flavorful chicken and fresh mushrooms. Pad Thai is perfectly portioned with a more than decent amount of tofu and shrimp. You + Me rolls = super yummy. 

Oh, and speedy delivery. A+++
author: Ashley C.

description:
My favorite neighborhood Thai spot. I come here often after a long day of work and the wait staff  is always so polite and friendly. Always seat me in the same seat too :) pad see ew is great and their beef salad with cabbage are my go-tos. 

We get delivery often as my boyfriend and I live less than 10 blocks away and the delivery man is always so nice too! He remembers that our door is ground level and always comes directly instead of calling us.
author: Zara H.

description: drunken noooooooooooodles! Theirs wasn't overly sweet and it came out piping hot! attentive waitress and an overall great dining experience.  decor is not 4stars but service and food is great
author: Paul K.

description: My go-to Thai place down the street from my house. Always delicious and always friendly service!
author: kittCAT L.

description: Dinner here hit the spot! Service was friendly and the food came out quickly. I ordered my go to Thai dish I often get the first time I go to Thai  restaurants (Drunken Noodles) and it compared favorably with other places I like. It had just the right amount of heat that I asked for. I'd go here again when in SF looking for Thai food.
author: Sheila M.

description: We got take out from here tonight and will now be loyal customers. We ordered #1, #21 made spicy, and #29. All we absolutely delicious and we're the perfect Thai food fix. Can't wait to comeback and eat in the restaurant because the staff all seemed lovely.
author: Emily S.

description: Yukol is easily my go-to place for dinner in the Marina. The service and food here is on point, and it's only a few blocks away from me. There hasn't been a bad dish I've ordered yet. My house favorites are the pad kee mao, red curry with duck, and the minced beef. If you're ever unsure of what to get, the wait staff has never done me wrong. They also deliver with a minimum purchase of $15. Make sure you check this place out!
author: Kevin L.

description:
Best yellow curry I've had thus far.
Flavorful and creamy with TONS of succulent chicken pieces!! It tasted like it was slow cooked on the bone all day (bones were not included, don't worry)!! I personally am not a fan of the chopped chicken breast since it tends to have a rubbery texture, so I was pleasantly surprised to see huge chunks of tender juicy chicken! 

Pad Thai was yummy, the chicken and basil dish was delicious, the satay did not disappoint, and their chicken, mushroom and lemon grass soup had a pleasant tang to it.

It is a small space, but it's cozy with good service. It's SF, so parking is tricky unless you park down by Marina greens. 

I will definitely be back for their chicken yellow curry! The leftovers were just as delicious!
author: Ariadna C.

description: Very happy to have stumbled on to this place a short walk from our hotel.  Service was outstanding and our waitress was very knowledgeable about ingredients.  Normally, our daughter with a severe milk allergy orders Satay Chicken when eating Thai/Vietnamese...however, theirs contains condensed milk.  Thankfully, the waitress was aware of that or we would have had to break out the Epi-pen!!!  We never expected milk in that dish since it is dairy free everywhere else we have gone.  Instead, she devoured all of the meat and sauce out of the Beef and Brocc over rice.  Broccoli was bitter, but I loved it...kids, not so much.  Hubby and I shared Seafood Kra Tiem, brown rice, and Angel Wings.  Very yummy and filling!  We would definitely go back for the delicious food and friendly staff!
author: Joni L.

description: This is my Favorite Thai Restaurant in the marina. I order out at least once a week. The green curry and pad Thai are my most favorite items on the menu. The green curry is the perfect amount of spice with a ton of fresh veggies. Delivery is crazy fast too. Definitely check this place out!!
author: Alexandra S.

description:
Present were most of Shakespeare's seven ages of man, including grandmas and a squealing toddler. I was initially the sole Asian aside from the servers and the only non-White person aside from the servers and cook(s). I believe that hadn't happened since Osaka. http://www.yelp.com/biz/osaka-sushi-san-francisco#hrid:OgFekcP98oMmKDkyTqTGZQ

#35 Pepper Garlic Dan Quayle $8.95 was savory and somewhat rich but also bony in a not-straightforward way. Quailman came with just a spoon and no knife. Among your options are using your hands, getting looks from other diners, and unimpressing your date. (But if you're dating here, I already doubt you're "the one".)

#9 Angela Lansbury Wings $8.95 were the bomb. Their serving size was comparable to the quail's, so they might as well be an entree and not "just" an appetizer. Or the quail should be an appetizer. The wings contain pancit Shanghai. Ask for gapi (Thai relative of bagook), lemon, and chicharrón. The bell will ring like in It's a Wonderful Life.

Tip: Learn to play spoons because you'll end up with at least one for every dish. http://youtu.be/T0_zzCLLRvE
author: Dan B.

description: Their chicken coconut soup was awesome and their delivery is so fast! Their pad thai was not my favorite, their shrimp was very "shrimpy/fishy" if that makes sense, but then again I am picky with my seafood! Great takeout spot
author: mackenzie e.

description: a tucked away thai gem in the marina - we were seated instantly and our waiter was very attentive, quick to get our order and would bring tea and water refills without having to prompt. food was better than some of the other neighborhood thai spots - would recommend the fish soup and red curry. we dropped in while on whole30 and the chef was accommodating and allowed for several substitutions. will be back!
author: Alexandra K.

description:
Walking up Lombard (and eventually on through to Lyon) meant that I randomly passed by Yukol Place.  I mentally tagged it as a reference point.

So, fast forward another hour or two (after completing the steps), and I was only thinking about dinner.  Turns out, I ended up here far sooner than originally anticipated!

We were able to sit in the front window and enjoy the street scene, although the ambiance in the restaurant was quite nice, too.

The service was great, and the food was also good.  It was a great local spot and the food was flavorful.  Granted, there's never enough of it, and it's never spicy enough, but at least it isn't bland like so many places around here fall into the trap of.
author: Jes G.

description: Everyone here is SO nice, when I get take out or delivery it's always right and even early, when we eat there with our squirmy short attention span special snowflake, they bring dishes out quickly and put them away fork his grubby grabby hands and are so sweet to him.
author: Poppy C.

description: Omg this place was so yummy!!!!!! I seriously don't have anything bad to say, about it. We shared 5 entrees, two of us has thai coffee and tea & our bill was only $87! So with tip, $15 per person. So great. I'll be going back.
author: Amber M.

description: I moved into the neighborhood and was craving Thai food so I went to Yelp.  I had been to Blackwood many times and I wanted to try something new and this popped up.  It's sorta obscure to find because it's nestled on a stretch of Lombard that is usually either fast traffic or tech shuttles dropping off nearby.  I ordered the Pad Thai (#56) and the Phrik Khing Gai Kung (#19) for pick-up.  I was super in the mood for Pad Thai and unfortunately wasn't completely wow-ed by Yukol's but it was pretty good.  It has an authentic and casual feel to the restaurant and definitely see myself coming back here for Thai in the Marina.
author: Eric M.

description: Very Nice Thai restaurant. Our waitress was nice and friendly and service was great. Our water glasses never emptied. Our food, which was the papaya salad &chicken laab came out in less then 5 minutes. Our curry took a little longer but it was still good. Good Thai place in San Francisco:)
author: Jessie C.

description: Delicious. Nice presentation . reasonable price .one nice waitress other bitchy one . over all very good
author: David M.

description: Just had to give a 5 star review to a favorite spot that's never disappointed throughout the years. Very friendly service, calm and clean ambiance, and delicious food. The veggies are always crisp and fresh which always says a lot about the quality of food... Can't wait to go back again. Please support this wonderful family establishment.
author: Kylie S.

description: We were timid to try a new Thai place because we are so loyal to our favorite place in Anaheim, but we ventured out tonight and it was a success! The soup was delicious and very lemony, the veggie eggrolls were awesome in that great dipping sauce, and the sautéed mixed vegetables were yummy too. They were very busy because it was New Year's Day but the service still managed to be friendly and fast. Great local joint!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Best peanut sauce I've ever had! 

Stopped in for an early dinner on our last night in San Fran. We were the first ones there after they opened at 5pm. By the time we were finishing our meal, the place started to get packed. 

I had the Pad Kee Maou. Delicious! I live in San Diego and we have some pretty delicious Thai food but my meal was to die for! My fiancé had the Pad Krapao with ground chicken. So so so good! We also had the crunchy vegetable roll. Everything was so good! And the prices were definitely right. 

If you're looking for good, authentic Thai food- this is the place! 

And make sure you get the peanut sauce!!
author: Shannon F.

description:
We have been going to Yukol Place for over 20 years and I have never been disappointed with the food, service and price. 

Yukol is a master in the art of Thai cooking...having tried to cook it myself this is not easy to do.  She is like the character in Like Water For Chocolate...she is just truly a magical chef...she is also one of the sweetest people I have ever met.

Whether you eat in or pick up to go...you can't go wrong.  Below is our standing order of favorite dishes:

Katong Thong #8 (not always available)
Chicken Satay #2 ( a standard but her peanut sauce is beyond compare)
Larb #4 (get the Duck it is amazing and I don't even like duck)
Kaeng Panang Beef #29 (YUM!)
Pad Krapao #34: (Sweet Basil Chicken)
Brown and White Rice

My kids have been raised on Yukol Place and now fight for each dish with gusto!  I have to order double of #29 and #4 as they can't get enough and love the leftovers.
 
Yukol's is about the food not the ambiance even though she has put a lot of love into the interior and the staff are all sweet and kind.  An old fashioned family run business...a very rare indeed.
author: Cheryl R.

description:
The Marina is a pretty sad place for Asian food.  It's either super white-washed, tasteless, or extremely expensive (usually a terrible combination of all three).  When Gatip Thai closed down, Husband and I panicked: where were we going to get our Thai food fix without spending an arm and a leg at Osha??

So we decided to explore the neighborhood a bit and ended up at Yukol Place.  It's relatively empty usually during the weeknights, but I noticed they do quite a bit of delivery or take-out service.  Great, because we get better service - and they are really wonderful and nice here.

We LOVE the crispy spring rolls, the fried shrimp appetizer, and the prawns in a clay pot with glass noodles.  Freaking delicious.  I also ordered a soup one time, which was basically a clear broth laden with glass noodles, chicken and pork, and lots of veggies.  The perfect chilly SF night meal (or if you're sick and want a nontraditional chicken noodle soup).

Prices are super reasonable - definitely way less than Osha.  There's a pretty good selection of different meat or veggie dishes and curries.  Plus, the portions are generous - perfect for a starving CCG after a day of work and volunteering.

Seriously friendly service - I'm a huge fan of this place, and I'm glad we can put it into our Thai food rotation.
author: Tori S.

description:
This is my go-to Thai restaurant and has been for years. Food is great (try the angel wings),  and they will have the best chicken and peanut sauce in town. Service is great. Nice atmosphere for a date, friends or alone. 

Best Thai in the north part of town.
author: Allan B.

description: The food here is delicious! Very fresh and the flavors stood apart from any other Thai food I have tasted.
author: Jamie C.

description:
This was my first meal in San Francisco and have to say was a little disappointed.  It looked from the outside like it could be a really great restaurant but I didn't enjoy my meal.

I asked the waitress to recommend a spicy chicken dish, and she recommended the spicy chicken curry (or something along those lines).  When it came out, there were maybe 5 small pieces of chicken with the rest being green beans.  Very few other vegetables on the plate.... I felt like I got a large plate of green beans with a side of chicken.  The curry also did not taste very good.  

The menu was very confusing as well, with many of the dishes sounding alike.  The description of my dish was nothing like what I received.  The wait-staff was very nice however and the food came out reasonably quick.  Just was not impressed with the food or menu.
author: Kate U.

description:
One of the best Thai dining experiences I've had in SF! A local neighborhood joint "where everyone knows your name," Yukol is cute, intimate, and just plain tasty!

We ordered lettuce wraps to start with, which were a world apart from any other version of lettuce wraps I've ever tasted at an Asian restaurant! Each ingredient was presented individually in a long boat-like plate;  the minced chicken flavor was out of this world! Yum yum. 

We also ordered the green curry (spicy!), pad thai, and a side of rice -- all of which were simply outstanding. Plentiful food for 3 people. I really enjoyed the cozy ambiance of the space, the service, and the meal.
author: Mansi A.

description:
Happy, random choice when hunger made us goofy and slightly desperate. #28 and 59: red curry with vegetables (green beans, baby corn, squash), pineapple, and duck, and a salad (spinach leaves with toppings--peanuts, lemon, onion, bell pepper, ginger, toasted coconut, and tamarind). Delicious food, friendly and efficient service, but only one selection (Singha) of beer.

Sometimes random works out!
author: Suzanne C.

description:
Great Thai Food!
Had the Tom Kha Gai soup and Kaeng Kiew Warn green curry.... Delicious.
author: Juliana I.

description: What happened to this place???? The food was horrible. I used to eat there lunch and it was one of my favorite Thai place. We went out to dinner and the food quality is not there anymore. I barley touched my food. I hope you will have another cook or something. Very disappointing!!
author: emukka y.

description:
YUKOL PLACE THAI CUISINE
This is one of the best Thai restaurants I've eaten at. After a long day in the city, my friends and I were starving and were looking for some good Thai food to fill our growling stomachs! We walked by a couple Thai restaurants before deciding on Yukok Place Thai Cuisine, based on the number of clientele and nice-looking/authentic Thai environment and decorations. We were immediately greeted with friendly service, and without further adieu, we opened up one of the most fancy-looking Thai menus (with a portrait of a Thai woman and binded with wooden coverings on the outside). With lots of choices to choose from, we decided upon the following:

1) Kaeng Karee Gai: boneless chicken in mild yellow curry with potato cubes -- this Thai curry was delicious!!! Very creamy, thick, and tasty, the curry was the perfect topping to the steamed rice. The curry was good enough that even without meat, I would enjoy it just with rice. Be that as it may, the chicken was tender and soft. Delicious! 

2) Ped Yang: boneless roast duck in honey, black bean and ginger sauce served in a bed of steamed spinach and cabbage -- this dish was an absolute delight! the duck was savory and the honey/black bean/ginger sauce gave it a nice sweetness.

3) Three Amigos: combination of sautéed shrimp, chicken, and scallops -- with three choices of meat, what's there to complain about! Slightly spicy, this dish went well with rice. With a variety of veggies to round out the meatiness, the Three Amigos was an excellent House Special that everyone should order.

4) Angel Wings: boneless chicken wings stuffed with silver noodles, black fungus and chicken, served with sweet and sour sauce -- this was one of the most unique appetizers that I have ever tried. Not your traditional chicken wings, these were stuffed and dipped in a sweet and sour sauce that was perfect! You can taste the crispiness of the roasted chicken wings with the chewiness of the stuffing!

5) Pad Thai: pan-fried Thai style rice noodles with shrimp, tofu, ground peanuts, egg, and bean sprouts in tamarind sauce -- this was one of the best Pad Thai I have ever tasted! The noodles were delightfully chewy and the sweet sauce was perfect. They gave lots of shrimps in this dish, so if you're a seafood lover, try this Pad Thai!!! Add some lime, and it's perfection! Best of all, the Pad Thai wasn't dry at all! I enjoyed the Pad Thai so much, I had to order another one for take-out for lunch the following day!

I love this place!!! Combined with the excellent ambiance of traditional Thai decorations, the service was very friendly; the owner even taught us how to say "thank you" in Thai (even though I already forgot how to say it)! The prices were very reasonable, ranging from $9.50-$12.00 a dish, on average. Give Yukol Place Thai Cuisine a try; you won't be sorry! You'll find yourself coming back over and over again!
author: Stanley C.

description: When I'm otw home from work and too lazy to cook, I'll put a call into Yukol Thai Place 15/20 min before I'll be home. I order the pad Thai, yellow curry, side of roti and the chicken satay and by the time I'm home my door bell has rung and then sweet super efficient delivery guy from Yukol Thai has arrived. The food is always stellar and never disappoints. I also like eating in when I have the time but the delivery is my go to.
author: Nicole H.

description: Good eats, good price. Super dessert-- mango with sticky rice! Friendly, service-minded staff!
author: J H.

description: Friendly and fast service.  Fresh and delicious food.  We had the spring rolls, pad thai with chicken, and steak with Chinese broccoli.  One of the most reasonably priced meals you can get in the Marina.  Will be back again soon.
author: Valerie F.

description:
This place is amazing.  Delicious food, great prices and super service.

The staff is always super friendly and have accommodated our last minute group lunches, which can be 6-12 people and also 6-12 cards to pay the check.  Never a complaint!

The food has never been disappointing.  I've gone here multiple times and it's always the same. I have never had a bad day.

I usually go for the Pad See Ew with BBQ pork and fried egg on top.  But the crispy chicken, curry chicken and even the veggie options are fantastic.  

Also, you have to get the cracking thai crispy crackers as an appetizer. 

But dont be in a rush - because good food takes time and sometimes the dishes may come out a little slow.

NOM! NOM! NOM!!
author: Nicole L.

description:
I love Yukol Thai! They are my go-to for Thai food in the Marina. The food is always delicious, the takeout service extremely efficient and they usually beat the delivery time they quote. Favorites include the Little Buttercups, the Green Curry and their meat dish with peanut sauce over cabbage. Honestly, I haven't had anything I didn't like here. Their pricing is also quite reasonable for the quality. Unlike Blackwood Thai who is a total rip off! 

I am moving out of the city next month and I will seriously miss my weekly dose of Yukol!
author: Jenny S.

description:
Great thai delivery and/or takeout.

#21 under house specialties is delicious.  Also try the pork thai fried rice (spicy), excellent!
author: Kate G.

description: This is a true 5 star restaurant both in food and service. The food is everything you would want in great Thai food very flavorful, fresh, and delicious. The service is always very friendly and more than willing to help with the menu. If your feeling thai food this is the best place in the city.
author: Michael P.

description: Excellent Thai food at an affordable price. The food seemed quite authentic and had a wide selection. Everything my table ordered was amazing, especially the duck red curry. The portions were good, I eat quite a bit and I was pretty full by the end of the meal. The food came out promptly, the service was good and our waitress was friendly. If you're in the area and are looking for Thai food, I would recommend this place!
author: Kevin H.

description:
Visiting from Tempe.
We chose our seat, enjoyed two hot soups (coconut / prawn was rich & slightly sour, yum!) to warm up after walking from Golden Gate Park.
Waitress asked perfect questions, made special order (fish substitute for calamari */plus/* peanut-coconut sauce), and was down-to-earth...& professional.

Green Curry was perfect match w/ peanut-coconut sauce! 
Every bite was fulfilling. Each sip of "Thai tea" was refreshing & tasty in it's own way.
Thank you...
author: D J.

description:
Pad See Ew and Green Curry were both good. I was surprised at how generous they were with the shrimp in the Pad See Ew, most people are stingy and few give both shrimp and chicken. NOM.

The mango sticky rice was the highlight of the meal, they gave us so much!
author: Jess C.

description: Nice portions, great prices, and great service. Fried bananas for dessert were unexpectedly amazing.
author: Thomson Y.

description: Seriously, some of the best Thai food I've ever had! I wish I could remember names of our dishes but I cant. Service was great and the place was quiet and inviting. I would definitely come back!
author: Michelle M.

description: Food is killer. Ambiance is a bit dated or maybe a better term is Van Ness Authentic. Drink beers and order the green chili dish. Service is great and easy to communicate my nut allergy. I didn't die. Five stars.
author: Chris S.

description:
Although this tends to be a favorite Thai spot for locals living in the Marina, I can't seem to find a signature dish that makes me crave this place out of the two times I've been here.  The coconut milk soup helps you warm up on a cold night, but it's nothing worth savoring over.  II experimented with the garlic quail, which was tender and cooked well.  When I asked about the garlic quail, the waitress couldn't tell me much except it was good.  However, it was so difficult to eat that it ruined my appetite.  Even the dessert was just okay with large fried chunks of banana, paired with coconut ice cream and whipped cream.  I've had it made better with smaller slices of banana to complement the ice cream, which shoes this place may lack the initiative and attention to detail just to get the dish out.  

Service is fast and friendly, but not helpful for recommending good dishes.  The decor is simple and dimly lit with white Christmas lights.  Parking can be tough on the street unless you find a nearby garage.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Compared to another Thai restaurant just a block away, Yukol Place appeared more welcoming.

Service was rather quick and the waitresses were very friendly. I ordered the Pad Kee Maou, and the serving size was more than I could handle, though I am a very light eater. It was very much worth the price, and the experience was wonderful.

Of all the Thai restaurants that I've been to, this may become one of my favorites.
author: Bonita K.

description: Wow!  Service and food were great!  Ordered the seafood soup and the flavor and seafood quality were outstanding.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Aj M.

description: Be aware they are no longer open for lunch hours!!! This broke our hearts since we frequently ordered work lunches from here. The You and Me Rolls are as amazing as others have said, as is their pumpkin curry (which is always on their "specials" menu). The portions are plentiful and great re-heated. My favorite Thai place in the city!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
4.5

We came in for our first meal here and enjoyed everything we had, and just ordered again for delivery. As far as Thai options go in the Marina, so far, after trying about 4-5 this is the best.
author: Captain B.

description: Love this place. Great spring rolls, soup is amazing, pad thai --Yum. Haven't had a bad dish. I've only done take out and delivery so I'm not sure what it's like to eat there. But I imagine it's great. The people are extremely nice in person or on the phone. What a gem this place is.
author: Samantha Y.

description: These guys are awesome!!. Great food and excellent staff. They always remember what I order. Parking is a little tough but it's worth the hassle. Best Thai food I have found in the city.
author: Will S.

description:
I like it, it is my goto place for lazy evenings takeaway.
All I tried was good, the LARB is great, and the soups have that real taste that is rare to find. This is real thai food, not a generic thai.
author: Yann K.

description:
So yummy! I ordered from this place late at night for a to-go order. We got the pad thai, yellow curry and chinese cabbage in a light soybean sauce. Personally I thought the pad thai was as good as any other, but not remarkable. I also felt the same way about the yellow curry. But the chinese cabbage was amazing. I couldn't stop eating it until I was so full I was going to burst. The vegetables were green and tender, the sauce ultra light and tasty. Nothing we ordered was under flavored or salty which is fantastic. 

Additionally, the people who work here are very, very nice. Everyone was smiling even though it was late in the day and I'm sure they were tired. They seemed genuinely happy that I, and every other customer was there.

I would seriously go back to this place just for the good vibes they were all putting out.
author: Cori N.

description: Everything we had was super delicious! The presentation was also very very nice. Service was wonderful. Would recommend. I have had better Thai ice tea before though. Very authentic!
author: Amanda L.

description:
#12 and #15 every time.

For the uninitiated, that's the lettuce cups that you can only have "in"-restaurant that come with every conceivable fixing from peanuts to tiny limes to ginger pieces, and the tom kha gai soup.

they also have many very tasty and healthy options in the specials (like the #19, prawns, chicken, basil, ginger, chili with green beans). 

My only advice, if you like it spicy (even moderately so), speak up! They play it safe, leaning strongly toward "american-strength" (i.e. pathetically non-spicy) if you don't but for us purists, can really kick it up several notches.

PS: their Thai iced teas are HUGE. last night we chose to split one despite both harboring an unhealthy obsession with that concoction.

My favorite thai place on the northern side of SF, by far.
author: Mike V.

description:
I NEVER get full at a Thai restaurant, but when I had a lunch special of basil garlic chicken, I had leftovers. 
good flavors,
pleasant service
nice atmosphere.
i will definitely come back here for more meals.
i started with a Thai version of the Indian pancake dish, roti with a delicious yellow curry dipping sauce.
i need more reasons to come to this part of town!
author: Jeff W.

description:
I ordered take out from here a little while ago and it was ok. Nothing special and there is another place that i liked better so I most likely won't come here ago.

I ordered the shrimp pad thai with tofu which was ok. I ordered it spicy and it came with a side of spicy vinegar sauce so i could make it at spicy as i wanted. It didn't have the same peanutty sweetness that i am used to with pad thai. Shrimp was fresh and had great texture. Noodles were thin. Not the best pad thai but it was tasty. 

Delivery prices were good. 

Again, I have been to other places that are so much better so i most likely will stick with them but if you need a Thai fix, this will hit the spot
author: Whitney S.

description:
Ordered delivery from this place. The beef was flavorless, the noodles were cold and dripping with oil (check out my photos).

Wasn't cheap either.

YUCK.
author: Sophia G.

description: EXCELLENT, fresh Thai food delivered!  The Duck Larb is soooo yummy. I'd never had it, but went with other reviews. Very glad I did. It's the kind of dish you think about later. . Pad Thai very good. Delivery was when they promised and still hot. Try it!
author: Vicki L.

description: Best takeout Thai food in SF! Can't go wrong with the Pad Kee Mau, Pad Thai, Tom Yum Ga, or Curry's.
author: Matt D.

description: When I found out that the parking at my hotel nearby only had first come/served parking, I knew I'd be on foot for my couple days in SF so finding a place to eat in close proximity was a must. Luckily this place was only about a block away and very good as well. I'm probably not the best judge of Thai food, but I know what I like and this hit all the marks. The service and decor were great and the food was perfect. I had the #34 PAD KRAPAO, a dish similar to what I usually get at Thai places even though it's never named the same. I ordered a side of steamed rice to go with it and when it all promptly arrived I wasn't disappointed. For desert, they had my favorite Thai concoction: Mango & Sticky rice, the portion for which was amazing, with no less than a whole mango!
author: Brian A.

description:
I just ordered take out from here and I am so disappointed. It took one hour to arrive (although she warned us of that) and the food was completely taste-less. 

We ordered the green curry with chicken (#26) and a four sauce shrimp dish (#22) and they were both so bland that neither were worth eating.

Guess we'll stick with Osha Thai from now on!
author: Christine M.

description: Ate here with my family of 9 from out of town. They hook us up with a nice table and the dishes we ordered, which we ordered a lot were tasty, fresh, and very flavorful. We eat Thai food frequently in Los Angeles and this was up there with the best of them. They were very accommodating and made us wanting to come back for more.
author: Mark M.

description:
Maybe I am spoiled because I have several amazing Thai food places in Fremont, but I was not thrilled by Yukol.

Typically, I cannot finish an entire entree at restaurants & always have to get about half to go. Today, not only did I clean my plate, but I left a little hungry!

I admit, I didn't order a noodle or rice dish, even so I felt the portion could have been more generous.

My house special #19 consisted of 3 yummy (but 3) prawns, a few slithers of chicken, some sauteed onions and bell peppers on a bed of green beans. The food was well prepared, but I would have liked a bit more.

Also, I disliked the fact that a scoop of brown rice costs an additional 2.50$....but I suppose this is fair game for a place in the Marina.

Polite and quick service, the place was practically empty on a weekday evening.
author: Nina M.

description:
Woah!  This place blew me away.  My wife and I went there based on a Yelp search.  We got the U and Me Rolls (from the specials board) to start.  The portion was large and they were delicious.  Best roll/egg roll/spring roll/etc that I've ever had.  If you come here, get them.  We also had chicken Pad thai which was good, but I've never had bad pad thai.  Last, and best, we had the pumpkin curry which was FANTASTIC.  The curry had the perfect balance of sweetness and spice.  They put green bell peppers and basil in which really filled out the flavor.  I can't wait to come back to Yulol Place.

Also, the service was A+.  The waitresses seemed to be genuinely pleased that we enjoyed our dinner so much.
author: Jenna G.

description: My favorite Thai place! Food is amazing and staff is so nice. I live nearby and get take out/delivery a couple times a month. Green curry with chicken (sometimes I add prawns too), pad ke mow, pad Thai, rotti appetizer and mango sticky rice are my go to's. Never had a bad experience or meal here. Consistently fantastic!
author: R B.

description: While the service is sometimes just fine, the food is usually pretty good. Easy and yummy take out. BBQ pork is great.
author: Angie W.

description:
My friend and I wandered into Yukol after searching for "soup" on my Yelp app. We were craving something hot and comforting to help cure our sore throats, and ended up ordering the following:

-Mieng mee krob (lettuce wrap with chicken & crispy noodles): A good appetizer for two. Chicken and crispy noodles were in separate dishes, and a platter of chopped limes, bell peppers, peanuts, and ginger were presented alongside. 

-Woon sen soup (glass noodle soup): Just what we needed-- hot, savory clear chicken broth with lots of yummy vegetables, tofu, chicken, and thin glass noodles. Portion would serve two, or three people at most.

-Vegetarian pad thai: Good. The noodles are a lot thinner than I'm used to at other Thai restaurants, but the flavor was nice.

Yukol's exterior is unassuming, but inside it's warm, intimiate and inviting. Service is polite and friendly, and they were quick to refill our water and Thai Jasmine tea without us asking. If I lived in the Marina, I'd definitely come back again, or get takeout service.
author: Elaine C.

description: I can only speak for the Po Tak soup..... a Thai Tom Yam concoction loaded with seafood and mushrooms. Best I've had in years and probably since I was in Thailand twenty years ago. Lemony, earthy and sea flavors compete for attention on the tongue. So Good. Only looking for a light meal for one so order was such. But I'm betting they are good on all points.
author: Dana D.

description: Yukol Thai was one of my favorite places to go get lunch with my bestie since we both work nearby. Since it changed its hours to dinner time only, we have been looking for another Thai place to fill the void but nothing compares! We frequented their lunch menu and everything is so flavorful and delicious, even their side salad that comes with a lunch dish is yummy. Staff is friendly and attentive. Decor needs a refresher but I'll take delicious food over decor any day! I miss my Yukol Thai!!! =(
author: Ruth L.

description:
Came here with the boyfriend last night. It was my 1st time trying this place and was impressed! There isn't a lot of Thai restaurant in the city that offers authentic taste, this one definitely made the list! 

Once you open the door to Yukol Place you are greeted with a gush of curry smell. Yummmy! The place feels very classy with dim lighting and candle burning on every table. I loved how their napkin has a rose printed on there. 

We ordered the Katong Thong for appetizer which is crispy buttercup filled with small dried shrimps, green peas, and diced chicken, served with cucumber salad on the side. YUMMMMYYY! It was SO delicious! We wanted to order another one but decided to wait and see if we still have room after we get our main dishes. 

I ordered the Kaeng Panang (spicy red curry) with chicken with bamboo shoot, carrot, and mushrooms, it was very tasteful. It was my first time trying red curry since i always order either the yellow or green curry at other Thai restaurants. It has just the right amount of spiciness for my taste, but the boyfriend said it could use a bit more kick. The chicken however was a bit on the dry side, but it was not horrible. I did see the table next to us ordered the Kaeng Ped which is boneless roast duck in red curry. I have to give that a try next time i come to Yukol. 

He ordered the Pad Thai. I am not a big fan of Pad Thai because it's a bit too sweet for my taste. So the Pad Thai here was no difference to me. I took a few bites and went straight back to my delicious curry! 

The servers here are all very nice. The service is quick and the dishes have good presentations. I highly recommend the Katong Thong and red curries! I will definitely be back for some more authentic Thai food!
author: Jenny G.

description: This place is super cute! Because of it's location, I was expecting just okay Thai food, but it was really good! I ordered seafood kra tiem, which was scallop, prawn and calamari with chili paste and garlic. For that they get 3.5 stars. But where they really shone was on service. I was with a large group and we asked for individual checks. Not only did the waitress put in the extra work for the individual checks, the kitchen also managed to bring out all our dishes in a timely manner. I heart Yukol.
author: Dani D.

description:
My first review, so here we go :-)

Ordered a SomTum salad and a green curry for delivery. Delivery was on time with what i have been told on the phone, great. During the phone call i was put on hold, i hung up after 4 minutes and tried again, probably they have been very busy at this time. Anyhow, the delivery person was very nice though.

Food: The SomTum salad was kind of disappointing. Not tasteless but i was missing the usual heat, the sour taste of limes and the salty taste of the fish sauce. I had better ones (which is the reason for the three stars).
The green curry was very delicious, the right heat for a green curry, fresh ingredients and a very balanced taste. If i would have left out the SomTum salad this would have been a four star rating.

Great fact: The restaurant starts delivering at $15.
author: Ben O.

description: Someone at my office was in charge of ordering lunch and it was a huge mistake. I got the chicken curry, as I am not a fan of thai food. I have never had food poisoning so bad in all my life. That was the food I ate that day, so I know this is where is happened. I am still not back to normal and have missed work as result. I knew it tasted funny, but gave it the benefit of the doubt. Never again. it was delivery, and it was hot, so I can only assume the chicken was bad of undercooked. Which ever it was, take it as a warning.
author: Andy T.

description:
Thanks to all the great yelp reviews, we gave this place a try and are SO HAPPY for the great experience! 

I love Tom Yum Goong soup and this place had some of the best I have ever had! I highly highly recommend it! There were plenty of prawns and the broth was perfectly spicy and not overly sweet.  The crispy fish entree was a wonderful hit with our family as well. 

I will definitely come here again!
author: Ada G.

description:
I live across the street, and this is my go-to place when I need food.  I'm a pretty picky eater and usually need the best food - Yukol is by far the quickest, most delicious, and best quality food I can get most conveniently.  Top-quality Thai place with extremely nice workers.  Whether you want Thai or just good food in general, I highly recommend it.
I usually only write reviews about bad experiences, so this is a new one for me.  :P
author: Joe B.

description:
I really enjoy this place.  My husband and I come here often, and they always remember us, where we sit and what we order.  

What we like:
- thai iced tea (the best I've had anywhere!)
- chicken satay
- tom kha gai (with shrimp)
- shrimp pad thai
- coconut ice cream (to die for!)

We also like their pla rad phrik, which is a crispy whole fish over veggies with a little kick to it.  Sometimes it's great, sometimes it's not.  At times, the fish seemed a little old, and therefore not very good.  Also, one time they accidentally gave us a TON of jalapeno peppers in the veggie mix, so it was impossible to eat.  

Despite some inconsistencies, we enjoy this place and will return. The people here are so kind and we always feel right at home when we come here.
author: Jade F.

description: So disappointing I walked out after two spoons of soup. The soup tasted liked sour dirty water. The waiter insisted this was how Tom Yum should be and that "coconut soup is not good for you; it makes you cough."  (Interestingly the coconut soup was served as part of the lunch combo.). I didn't even taste the green curry which came thoroughly curdled.  Spoiled ingredients?
author: Aimee F.

description:
This is the best Thai place I have ever been to. 
The hot thai tea was refilled constantly. 
I had Pad Thai and Tom Kai Pak. The Tom Kai Pak was perfect as was the Pad Thai. The sauce was excellent and the noodles were thinner than I am used to. The thin noodes made the texture silky. I could have done without the shrimp though, it tasted a little oily to me. However, I would give it a try again and see if it was a one time thing. 
For dessert we had the coconut ice cream and fried banana. The ice cream was perfect and refreshing. The banana had a little too much dough around it though. I like a crispy banana with a light batter. 
The staff is friendly and the ambiance is nice.
author: Elisabeth H.

description: Amazing food, great service! I love their pad Thai, which tastes very authentic. Generous portions and convenient takeout keep me coming back for more!
author: Emily V.

description: One of the best values in the city. Have been going there for almost 20 years and the quality remains high with prices very reasonable.
author: jack b.

description: Delicious! Cute place with roses on the tables. Thai iced tea was good, as was the Pad Thai. I always start with Pad Thai-if they can't do that right, I leave. Also got #20 sweet and sour chicken and shrimp, pretty good, and #37 beef with Chinese broccoli- good buy almost too garlicky. Family style, no kids menu. Husband loved the constantly replenished hot tea. Water was lemony.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
First, the positives: Cute restaurant with decorations from Thailand. Attentive service.

On to the food: I've eaten at this restaurant several times over the years. During my most recent dining experience, the quality of the food was subpar. For example, the duck was 95% skin and 5% meat. The chicken was stringy. Bleh. For what they charge, the quality of the ingredients should be higher.

In the past when I've ordered rice, the rice came in pot; this past time we received one small pressed cup mound and that's it. It's plain rice, not caviar, so why be so stingy? I do not need to be put on a restricted carb diet.

There are better Thai restaurants in this city. I'll be skipping this one in the future.
author: Jolie S.

description: Really delicious food, cozy place, great atmosphere.  They also do great take out.  This is the place I go with good friends to have a relaxing cozy dinner outside of the bustling consumer atmosphere of the Marina.  Great for families too, plenty of healthy options the kiddos will enjoy.  Super nice people too.
author: Janet G.

description: Definitely a fan.  The food is authentic and the service is genuine.  I'm going back!
author: Ken M.

description: All I have to say is - excellent service, delicious food, and quick delivery!! Happy to live nearby such a great Thai place.  Definitely 5 stars!
author: Sophia R.

description:
If you're looking for good Thai food at a great price- this is the place! At Yukol, you can enjoy a comfortable atmosphere (not pretentious), genuine service, and some tasty authentic Thai food. 

We started with the Chicken Satay and were pleasantly surprised by the tender chicken and complex peanut dipping sauce paired with a delicate cucumber salad. 

For the main course, we wanted to try both a noodle and curry dish so we opted for: #27 KAENG DANG ( Choice of beef, chicken, or pork in medium spicy red curry with bamboo shoots, cauliflower, baby corn, bell pepper, and a touch of basil) with chicken. 
We also ordered the: # 56 PAD THAI ( Pan-fried Thai style rice noodles with shrimp, tofu, ground peanuts, egg and bean sprouts in tamarind sauce.) with chicken instead of shrimp as well as a side of rice.
Both dishes were packed with flavor and the generous portions were great for sharing. 

Due to the portion size we had some leftovers and opted to have them packed. The check was paid promptly and we waited several more minutes for our to-go bag. Assuming that they forgot we exited the restaurant (it was really not a big deal and the packed portion was very small). However, to our surprise what I believe was one of the owners followed us outside apologizing and handing us a full order of the delicious PAD THAI. Apparently there was some confusion in the kitchen and our to-go portion had been discarded so they took the time to fix a full order to-go. Not many restaurants offer this level of caring and service.

Overall, the food was good and the service was great. The kitchen is extremely efficient- even with a packed dining room the food came out quickly and the service was attentive. We will definitely be back soon.
author: Cara M.

description:
I work in the area and I LOVE Thai food. I have tried many different places but I find this place to be the most consistent. The food is always good if not great, even with delivery. The price is pretty average for Thai but they give you a generous portion.
I tend to order from this Thai place most.
author: Serene M.

description: I went here because it was mentioned favorably in a review of the hotel I was staying in.  They don't list beer or wine online, but there is a selection there. I ordered hot sake and the tom kha pak, which is vegetable but not vegetarian because it has fish sauce (nonnegotiable).  Disappointingly, I didn't realize I could order the curries on the menu w/o meat (but not w/o MSG).  The soup tasted fresh and great, and the service was good.
author: Shaleen M.

description: The staff-- Stephanie-- were extremely attentive and welcoming-- and it didn't hurt that the food was good too!
author: Conrad W.

description: Our go-to spot for Thai food in the city. I am a tough critic of Tom Kha Gai soup and Yukol have a tasty one. Not the fanciest place, but there's never a wait, servers are friendly, and prices are pretty reasonable. The Pad Thai and Green Curry dishes are our usual choices that are consistently good.
author: Ryan E.

description: Small place. The food and service were great. So many good flavors. Glad we got in on a Saturday night.
author: Gary S.

description:
Amazing Place!!  One of the better Thai restaurants I've been to.  I patronized this place recently with my girlfriend and fell  in love with it.  

The Food.  The food was exceptional.  I ordered the Kaeng Ped (Roasted Duck Curry) and a Thai Iced Tea, and my girlfriend chose the Pad Woon Sen.  Both were very flavorful. I ordered my hot, but wasn't really as hot as I prefer.  My girlfriend enjoyed her noodles as well.  For dessert we tried the fried banana with coconut ice cream.  It was delicious!  The bananas were a bit too ripe, but the batter itself was not soggy at all.

The Service. They were very friendly, and checked back regularly making sure everything was to our liking.  The food came promptly, and the waitresses were quick to retrieve our plates.

The Building.  The restaurant was my favorite part of the entire experience.  Very well decorated with a noticeable asian influence.  It is hard to find convenient parking, due to the shopping boutiques in the surrounding area, so your best bet is to park in one of the parking structures.

Overall, this place may be my favorite Thai restaurant to date.  I would recommend them to anybody who loves great Thai cuisine.  I will most definitely be heading back there soon!
author: Christian M.

description: Real kitchen nightmares stuff. The Tom Yum soup tastes like hot dishwater. This seems to be a case where to offset low prices for lunch the staff served sub par food to people in a hurry. As is the case with all controversies, the staff telling you the problem is with your sense of taste does little to allay the dispute. In the end they took the soup off the bill but not the uneaten entree. Marina restaurants to avoid is a growing list. Avoid.
author: Christopher F.

description: We were here on a short visit to San Francisco and thankfully stumbled across this place via Yelp.  The Tom Yum Goong was spectacular with a wonderful chilli spice.  The Panang Curry was perfect in every way.  If you're looking for great Thai in the Marina District stop here!
author: Michael U.

description: Best thing about this place - they deliver! And have pretty good prices. A group of us at work order lunch from here on a regular basis. While other restaurants always seems to get at least one of our orders wrong, Yukol never fails! The food is yummy and delivered in a timely manner.
author: J B.

description: So I've been going here since I was 8 yrs old and still the best thai I've had in sf. Yukol is still in the kitchen and everything tastes as it did 20 yrs ago. The curry butter cups are a favorite of mine and the duck larb is the best in town. The rest of the staff are very friendly and have been there since the beginning. I always look forward to eating here and will always come for more.
author: Scott M.

description: I love this place! The number 15 soup is TO DIE FOR. Everyone that works here is super nice and their takeout is FAST! Everything is very fresh... Not like a lot of other Thai places. My favorite Thai spot in the city!
author: Char K.

description: Best Thai food I have found in SF. Quick delivery and they always get the order correct. I order here once a week and my husband and I love it! Thank you :)
author: Jessica L.

description: So delicious! I was going to go to Gatip because I heard that it was really good, but when we got there it was closed. My friend yelped to find the nearest Thai food place and she saw Yukol had really good reviews. We decided to go here and I'm so glad we did! The service was great, the atmosphere was great, the food came pretty fast and everyone was very friendly.  We ordered the Poh Pier Tod, Pad Kee Mao and the Phrik Khing Gai Kung. All three were very very tasty! Will definitely be back when ever I'm back in town!
author: Raphaelle C.

description:
Unbelievable food here. 

This place is in my top 5 restaurants list.

They are probably the best Thai food I've had so far.

Curries are very flavorful as well as the soups here. 

I highly encourage giving it a try.
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description:
This place is a gem. We (13 people) showed up without reservations on a Thursday evening, no problem. The food looked appetizing and fresh and tasted deliciously. The service was prompt and courteous. I love Thai food and this place delivers. 

I had salmon green curry. Come hungry - leave satisfied.
author: Tom T.

description: VERY DISAPPOINTING.  I ordered the green curry with eggplant.  They served me one small piece of eggplant, the rest of the dish was bok choy and bamboo shoots.  When I asked them "where is the eggplant?" they had some strange answers about where the eggplant was grown.  huh?  The veggies were boiled, not sauteed. The green curry was OK, nothing to get excited about.  I would NOT recommend this place.
author: Cindy U.

description:
Oil and butter should be accents, not food groups. 

Look. I get it. I'm pickier than most when it comes to my definition of how food should be made. But Yukol used so much oil in my prawn, chicken and veggie dish (#19) that the food shined, my kitchen sink stained and an entire roll of paper towels was used cleaning up the mess. There is some sarcasm in that last one. Go with it.

No amount of friendly service and generous portions (both of which were true) can offset using that much completely unnecessary oil.
author: Jason B.

description:
Just got back from my first trip to Yukol, the owner's name... 

tom yum... Cristof (last reviewer) had it all right.. it's so flavorful it was ridiculous! haven't had such great soup in a long time. Our dinner party each ordered one dish...

Chicken yellow curry, traditional pad thai, house specialty of prawns and chicken in a sweet basil sauce with mushrooms, black fungus (another type of mushroom), etc

Let me just say: wow! couldn't believe the chicken thighs fell off the bone, they were timed so perfectly. Really impressive prices for the ambience and the portions. Flavorful and done right. What a perfect place to go after the Presidio! Right on north side ofLombard, close to the trends of Chestnut
author: Jana C.

description:
Carb load time. It was less than 12 hours before the big race, and Lovie and I were ready for some no holds barred carb fest. Since we ate some rather dismal Spaghetti Factory spaghetti the night before, we were ready for a change. I brought up a Thai place that was in the area (Tom Yum), but to my disappointment, it closed down. This place was just steps away from our hotel, and looked pretty busy, so we thought, "Why not?"

The atmosphere was nice, cozy, romantically candlelit. We were seated next to the window next to another Asian girl-Caucasian guy couple, whom I noticed during our dining experience were pretty square. Oh well. 

The service here is impeccable, along with the food:

Soup:
We had the #16 Tom Yum Goong. A hot and sour prawn soup with lemongrass and tomatoes. Two words: yum yum! The perfect start to dinner on one chilly night. The spice and sour hit spots on the palate that I normally wouldn't have. Very similar to a Filipino soup dish that uses tamarind powder for the spice. The whole clay pot bowl was killed within minutes.

Main Dishes:
#24 Pad Ka Meur - chinese eggplant with prawn and chicken sauteed in a garlic chili sauce. This was delish! One of my favs, though, Lovie didn't care so much for it. The eggplant was cooked perfectly...still somewhat tender, but not mushy. 

#56 Pad Thai - Pad Thai me baby...I love how every came separated so I got to mix it. Since I'm not a big fan of bean sprouts, I was able to control the bean sproutage. 

All this with cups of jasmine rice, a Tiger beer, and hot Thai tea, we demolished everything. And we couldn't beat the total price: $40.27. For Saturday night dinner for two in the city, that's pretty unheard of. We left with satisfied bellies, ready to race the next day!
author: Grace L.

description: We have been dining at Yukol for over 20 years and the food is still outstanding, fresh and delicious. The staff are friendly, service is excellent.
author: Barbara H.

description:
Pros:
Best Thai delivery in northern SF, hands down. I would eat at their physical location, which is saying a lot for a delivery place. 

Cons:
The curries can drip in the plastic bag and make a mess at home if you're not careful. 

Fun:
Off-menu items and their spicy red curry with duck (next time I'll do chicken though)
author: Mike G.

description:
I like Yukol Place.  Based on the ambiance, food, and service, it's one of the best places for Thai on Lombard.  

As a tofu muncher, I give it four stars.  But if it means anything, my carnivorous friend gives this restaurant a five based on their tender beef, alone.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
We were quite hungry and looked for a place to eat up and around Lombart and ran into this place here.  Looked at the menu and also seen a Yelp sticker on the window so we decided to give it a shot.
The service was great and we got seated right away.  The waitresses are very friendly here.  Decor here is quite cool, not overdone and not too tacky.  

Our food came very quick and looked like it was cooked from scratch.
I was impressed with the taste of everything in it, nice portions, fresh veggies, and good tasting chicken and beef!  We ordered one green curry and a red one from what I remember and had brown rice on the side.

Our server was kind enough to fill our plates herself with rice and even offered free refills on the rice a couple times for a big eater like myself :P
They are very attentive and kind so I will definitely come back to this place when I am in SF again :)
author: Roger M.

description:
If I could only eat one ethnic food for the rest of my life, it would be Thai. That is, if I'm not in San Francisco for the rest of my life. The Thai food I've had here is nothing to write home about--and I e-mail home everyday.

Yukol Place isn't memorable in a good way, but not in a bad way either. The food has a home-cooked quality. We ordered the spring rolls, the red curry with chicken, and the crispy snapper. The spring rolls were served with the ubiquitous Thai sweet chili sauce, which makes everything taste good. None of us cared for the red curry that much--it was definitely not near the best I've had. The snapper was the standout dish. The fillets were deep-fried and then drenched in savory deep brown sauce with green beans--pretty delectable.

This restaurant is rated 4.5 stars, the highest for any Thai restaurant in the area. I'd give it two star relative to best Thai eateries I've been to around the world. Please tell me there's better out here in San Francisco! I'm looking specifically for a place with outstanding red curry, crispy chicken basil and of course, Pad Thai. Yeeelp me.
author: Liz T.

description: #29 Curry is Delicious.  Fast delivery. Fair prices.  Food is always REALLY good.  This is my go-to Thai place.
author: Sierra S.

description:
Good food, terrible terrible service.

Took 20 mins just to get a soda.
author: kim k.

description: We stopped by here on our way to the BATS Improv Theater, about an hour before our show started. YELP reviews said it was good, and when we arrived it didn't seem too busy.  I got the Pad Khee Mao with chicken and shrimp and my BF got the Massaman curry and both dishes were delicious.  The mango sticky rice at the end was perfect and the sticky rice was even garnished with a little mint leaf - too cute.  Interior is traditionally decorated and service was real quick - we were in and out with our meals and dessert in 40 minutes.  Good reliable thai food, exactly what we wanted!
author: Mengo Z.

description:
I think the best part of this restaurant is that the service and the atmosphere is very homey. The people are all so nice here and love to make sure you have a good experience. One of our dishes was a little bit spicy and she offered to add some more of the meats and veggies into it to dilute the spice. They also gave us a great dessert on the house of sweet rice and mangoes, which was a great touch.

Had: the Roti, and the number 18. The lettuce wraps are also pretty good. And for lunch they've got a great special combo set you can choose from.

I still think that this could be a little more authentic, as I've had a lot of thai food and I think Brown Sugar in Boston is still one of my favorite places to eat at. The knock on here is that the menu is relatively small, and one of my friends ordered something that looked almost exactly like mine....
author: Jon H.

description: Our classic Thai restaurant next to our place. Service is good, food is authentic and prices are definitely fine.
author: Lionel F.

description: The food and service at the Yukol Place Thai Cuisine restaurant is really great. The waiters are friendly and the food is authentic. Highly recommend the Pad Thai. It was very flavorful and moist. The only setback was that we ordered a fried banana with coconut ice cream and they didn't have bananas.
author: Chloe K.

description:
I gotta say...usually I'm disappointed by Thai food.  It always sounds so good in theory, then you get it and its just lackluster.

However, Yukol, in my opinion is the best Thai I've ever had.  I'm not a Thai food expert, so all you Thai food enthusiasts may disagree.  But, for the everyday citizen looking for some quality Thai food that bursts with flavors...order from here.

I especially like the Green Curry.  And, I usually DISLIKE Pad Thai.  However, I tried my friend's and it was the best I've ever had.  Get the sticky mango rice too.  Sooo good.  So much better than Osha.  Makes Osha look like PF Changs.  

I do want to note that I've never eaten in-house, just delivery.  However, their delivery is clutch.  Yesssssss.
author: Genevieve M.

description:
My colleague and I were returning to San Rafael from a meeting in San Francisco and at 3 PM we hadn't had lunch.  Using his new iPhone he found Yukoi as we were driving down Lombard Street.  Just as they were about to put the closed sign in the door window, we knocked.  The friendly waitress let us in.  We were were the only two customers in the place.  Shortly after we sat down a well dressed woman knocked at the closed door.  We heard her explain to the waitress if she could order takeout for five as she was on her way to Napa!  Sure enough they let her in as she waited for her order.

Needless to say we were impressed but the biggest surprise of all was the lunch--complete with soup, salad and entree.  I have never seen such beautiful food.  Everything was utterly fresh, crisp, colorful.  The cooked vegetables were in a light transparent sauce and unforgettably delicious.  Why can't more restaurants be like this?
author: Gasper S.

description:
