Love this place! Was looking for a great Thai place in the area and found Yukol Place. On a Thursday night it was really quiet in the dining room, but lots of food going out for delivery. 

The service was amazing, they were really attentive. The food was so reasonably priced and decent portions. Besides all of that it was delicious! Some of the best Thai food I have ever had. Even though their veggie menu is a bit limited, it seems like they can make alot of their dishes and sub in tofu as a protein. Even though it's a trek for me, I need to come back here.
author: J E.

description:
I really liked this place.
The restaurant was not empty, but EXTREMELY quiet -- calming even.
The tom kha soup was delicious and chock full of veggies. I loved it. Mmmmm.
My green curry was mighty tasty. They used a lot of the same yummy veggies as were in the tom kha.
The thai brown rice was like MN wild rice.
My friend ordered poorly - sweet and sour veggies. It was KETCHUP HELL.
The waitress was awesome. She was nice, but unobtrusive, knowledgeable and wonderful.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Looking for the best Thai place in San Francisco, this is one of the places that came up and it didn't disappoint.

For the appetizer got the roti, which wasn't what I was used to, but still very good. It was more like a pancake, vs a light flaky roti I was expecting. It was served with a light peanut sauce and was tasty.

We shared 3 entrees, the green curry, shrimp/chicken egglpant stir fry, and pepper grilled pork. All were spot on, the green curry had a good spice to it. The grilled pepper pork was probably the best dish, sliced thing yet still juicy. The stir fry was good, but lacked shrimp.

All in all, a good place for Thai.
author: Eddy N.

description:
Very charming place.
Started off with this really awesome salad with a blueberry vinaigrette. YES BLUEBERRY! The slivered almonds and cranberries were a great addition to the salad ( I know not very thai, but very delicious).

Server recommended the bbq pork with fried rice. it was really good. The fried rice was really simple, but still very flavorful. Pork was cooked perfectly. The BF got the green curry. Full of perfectly cooked veggies and SPICY! Lots of thai chili's in it. but nonetheless delicious. Will definitely be coming back if we're ever in the neighborhood again.
author: Jen T.

description:
Really good Thai food and they are great for delivery (only within the Marina, though). I have ordered from them a number of times and highly recommend the Tom Kha coconut soup (I get a half order since I live alone and it is PLENTY), I also like the Pad Thai alot. Other things I have ordered that have never disappointed are the Adam and Eve Salad (I like this over the papaya salad) and the Green Curry (really flavorful, lots of chicken and veggies and not too spicy).

Would love to actually go in and try other things on the menu sometime, rather than ordering takeout solo since its hard to try more than a few things if you live alone.

Very friendly staff and fast delivery, thanks Yukol!
author: Sarah A.

description: My favorite dish is the green curry and shrimp pad thai, It's sooo good that every time I go there I order the same thing. One of the best in the City so far.
author: Katelyn D.

description: A person from Thailand recommended this place.  The curry and mekrong I had was very good.  It's nice inside, but service can be slow.
author: Matthew P.

description: The service at this place is phenomenal. The waitresses are very friendly and attentive, they made sure my glass was full of water the second it was half full. Food came out really fast and it tasted good.
author: Kimberly W.

description:
I've been here to lunch, I've had them deliver dinner, and I've had takeout.  Their food is consistently delicious.  Their spicy eggplant with duck is not greasy like most duck dishes at Thai restaurants.  I enjoy their green curry and pad see ew.

They really are the best delivery place in the Marina/Cow Hollow/Pac Heights area.  In fact, if they would deliver to SoMa, I'd order from them more often.

Writing this review makes me hungry for Yukoi Thai.
author: Becca L.

description:
Best Thai food in the Marina!

The staff here are really friendly and nice.  My favorites are the curries, the green curry is really good and you can't go wrong with Pad Thai.  I have eaten here and had take out and I prefer to eat-in; for some reason the take out is just not as good.  The prices are not the cheapest but it's worth it!
author: Selena G.

description:
Ordered delivery a few days ago for dinner. When ordering Thai food I always get pad see yew which Yukol didnt have. So I settled for pad see mauo which was pretty darn tasty plus it was spicy (I love spice!). It had thick rice noodles with shrimp, chicken, and veggies in a garlic chili sauce. I also ordered param pak, assorted veggies and tofu with peanut sauce, which was also really good. The peanut sauce wasn't too thick and the veggies were fresh and crisp. 

The food came quick, the servings pretty generous and reasonably priced. I will be ordering from here again when I want late night Thai food.
author: danielle l.

description:
DEE-licious!  

Good location, nice ambiance, friendly service, tasty food and affordable!  

I also liked that they LISTENED to our party's specific request to take any and all peanut base out of the food due to my friend's severe allergy.  Thankfully we all made it out of there in peace (and full bellys) and did not have to call 911!  

Thanks Yukol Place!
author: Swetha G.

description:
My new fave Thai delivery! I got a terrible cold and craved nothing but spicy and soup - this place popped up as a delivery option and I can't believe it's been within blocks of my home for this long and I had no clue! We tried a red curry with chicken, basil beef and silver noodle soup - all delicious; it was exactly what I needed to help my sore throat and stuffed sinuses. Only reasons for a 4-star review: the portions were slightly smaller than I expected for the price, and the delivery took close to an hour.

Yukol Thai is now my go-to for Thai food, I can't wait to taste out the rest of the menu!
author: Ashley D.

description: Excellent restaurant!! We had Chicken Pad Thai (instead of shrimp) and was delicious! A great reminder of our trip in Thailand a few years ago!
author: Jessy G.

description: I was staying a couple doors down at the Days Inn and as I looked at the menu posted outside a patron entered and said "It is so good, you have to try it."  I ordered #23 and it was delicious - prawns, chicken, coconut sauce, peanuts, spinach and cabbage.  The only bummer was the rice was additional...maybe that's a San Fran thing.
author: Julia G.

description:
Dear Yelpers,

You reviewed, and you delivered. Yukoi Thai did not disappoint!

The service was superb and meal was delectable. 

We will UNDOUBTEDLY be back!
author: Annalise F.

description:
Yukol certainly brings its A game. Accordingly, they're a tried and true regular in the delivery rotation. 

Tonight, we took Mom here after a busy day moving and it was fresh and tasty!  My favourites are your standard yellow thai curry (with chicken) and the Nuer Ob, marinated sirloin beef served on cabbage with chili sauce!
author: I. O.

description:
I've been to this restaurant for lunch twice.  Not always crowded, but someone's always inside.  I'm not huge on Thai food like my girlfriend, but everytime i eat here, it's always good.  i've never had anything here i didn't like.  

Also, portions are large and the price is great.  The service here is very friendly.  So i recommend this restaurant!
author: George B.

description:
Fantastic experience!
We live in the neighborhood, but had never tried this Thai restaurant. We were craving Asian food, sick of pizza and feeling adventurous. This was an incredible meal. Picking random meals (based on description) we had three delicious dishes and have a left over meal for tomorrow (or midnight). We had spring rolls, green papaya salad and pepper beef (the pad thai is for tomorrow). I was so impressed. The food was hot, delivered faster than we expected and utterly delicious. I'm putting them on autodail tomorrow!
The pepper beef came with a HOT sauce that I thoroughly enjoyed and included a large wedge of salad to wrap it in (I just ate the lettuce and had the beef on rice), the green papaya salad was generous and included plenty of peanuts. The spring rolls came with a sweet sauce and was vegetarian (I think). A great meal. One tip: don't try to eat it in bed! it does require dishes as the (carefully wrapped) meals we ordered had sauce.
I'm very picky and this was a full scale winner.
Oh, and their website is very descriptive.
author: Judith B.

description:
Just a little background, I'm absolutely in love with Thai food. Tom Yum, Pad Thai, Drunken Noodles, Larb, Basil anything, Pineapple Fried Rice, green curry, red curry, any curry will be deliciously shoved into my mouth.

Best Thai place evar. Evar? Evar. Went here for a lovely birthday dinner with the lovely friends.

The place is cozy; not too small and not too big, and decorated beautifully. Our menus were actually made out of wood and opened on small hinges. I delight in the small details.

Service was impeccable. Waitresses were friendly and always made sure everything was ok, water glasses were always filled, and plates immediately taken away when we were finished with them. It really made me aware of just how much good service enhances the dining experience.

Duck larb was too salty, but was definitely FLAVORFUL and delicious. Shredded duck meat tossed with mint and other herbs and seasoned with delicious sauce.. we wrapped a spoonful into small leaves of cabbage and chomped down. 

Red and green curries were the perfect size and complimented the jasmine rice perfectly. Not too creamy or sweet, and piled with vegetables and meat.

Their FISH. Omg their fish!! Crispily fried on the outside and TENDER and melt in your mouth delicious on the inside! Sweet and sour sauce and topped with string beans (my FAVORITE kind of beans!). I will eat this everyday. 
 
Pad Thai was excellent, though nothing special.

Love this place. If I lived in the Marina, I would just go here/get delivery all day everyday.

P.S. They seemed to be trying for the fanciness a little too much with their plates. Big and taking-up-space rectangles that did some unwanted revolving while we ate.
author: Carolyn K.

description: One of the best Thai restaurants I've been to,  I always order fish cakes as they vary a lot between thai places.  Theirs are one of the best.    Hey, I  forgot my leftovers , I left the bag on the table,  damn it.    I'll be back soon.
author: Dan P.

description: I called in an order for takeout, so I can't give a review on the full dining experience there quite yet.   But the food itself was very good.  Ordered some basic Pad Thai noodles and the Panang Curry with chicken.  The Pad Thai was very good, and had a very good appearance even in the takeout box.  The Panang was delish and I didn't want to stop eating it.  The portions are pretty generous, especially for the price.  I think it was about $7-$9 per entree (notttt bad).  Will definitely be back.  Definitely one of the good Thai places in the city.
author: Juliana K.

description:
Ok, I went to this place after I had spent years in a country that lacks Thai food and so maybe my expectations were too high. Or maybe I've been spoiled by a vacation in Thailand or living in Berkeley for 4 years, but either way after reading all the positive reviews from yelp my only reponse can be... seriously?!? My first time here was definitely a one star experience, but I was dragged back by a friend, the name of the restaurant hadn't rung a bell, but the minute I walked in, the lightbulb went off. But by then it was too late to walk out, and we had already spent a good hour arguing over where to eat in the first place.

Luckily my 2nd experience was better than my 1st. But my expectations were extremely low and I was starving. 

Started with Angel Wings - Which I had actually remembered having my first time, it's usually a really good thing or a really bad thing if I remember only one specific dish. In this case, it was a good thing, cause it was the best thing about the meal last time and the best thing about the meal this time. It was piping hot, the chicken was perfectly crispy, and the vermicelli misture inside was cooked wonderfully.

KAENG DANG(Red curry with Pork) - last time I had the green with pork and it was very disappointing. But the red fared better, needed more spice though.

PAD MA KEUR (Sautéed prawn and chicken with Japanese eggplant, egg, onion, and fresh basil in chili garlic sauce) - my friend's favorite dish. The eggplant was soooooo good because it soaked up all the wonderful flavors of the sauce, but the prawn and chicken were both overcooked. If I sat there and picked only at the veggies it woulda been the perfect dish.

Sticky Rice covered in Coconut sauce served with fresh mango. It's impossible to have a bad experience with this dish, unless you overcook the rice or something. I remember last time they had run out, so actually that was a bad experience, but this time they had it, and it was warm, gooey, and delicious.

I am convinced that there is no fantastic Thai food in SF, only mediocre. Must drive to Berkeley in the future when the Thai cravings are a-calling.
author: Alison T.

description: Direct Access by Landmark Education brought us to the City for the weekend. Checking with Yelp we found Yukol Thai Cuisine a block from our Hotel. A reviewer recommended the Green Curry...thank you! The curry arrived hot and upon tasting I found a light, full flavored curry and coconut milk flavor that had just the right amount of 'heat'. The shrimp which were plentiful were done to perfection. Oh yes the Silver Rolls appetizer also arrived hot and were presented like a work of art. With the light but robust sweet chili dipping sauce it was a great prelude to the main course. The service was good and the ambiance is authentic, warm and inviting. The rest room might be the cleanest EVER!
author: Michael M.

description:
I've become a huge fan of this place for Thai food.. It's more than a typical hole-in-the-wall SF style but still very easy going.  Love the staff here..  Great to bring your folks here as well as have a party with friends, they're great with big groups.  We had a New Year eve dinner here with like 20 people and they were on point.

Food wise is where they win for me.  They really do the spicy right and their dishes are the best tasting Thai food in SF in my opinion.. I'm not Thai though, so I'm not sure how authentic they are.
author: greg s.

description: This place always guarantees good food and great service.  We've been going there for 10+ years and always have the same waitress, she is super efficient and attentive.  I love their soup, duck curry, papaya salad and a fish dish (#50)... We live in San Jose, but it's totally worth the drive to SF for the food...
author: Lucy L.

description:
Super place!  We have been coming here for years.  Great food, atmosphere, super-clean, excellent prices.  

Richard Clark
author: Richard C.

description:
I'm a thai food fanatic, and am always looking for new places to experience. I ordered delivery from here last night, and this place was OK, but not great. Like it says for two starts "Meh, I've experienced better." 

The curry was really spicy (not to my taste) and not as sweet as typical. I didn't love it (and that's saying a lot coming from someone who LOVES thai food). The noodles were OK, but not great.  I was disappointed by the taste of the food.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Solid Thai cuisine. Best sit down and take-out Thai in Marina.
author: Kennie B.

description: Nice experience here.  The food was really good and the service was very good as well.  People are really nice and friendly, seems to be a family run business.  Definitely a place to visit when you go to San Francisco.
author: Angie K.

description: I ordered chicken skewers and pad thai from here the other night. I like that their standard pad thai comes with shrimp only- no chicken. Overall, the food was a bit too greasy, but it sure hit the spot. Delivery is prompt.
author: Tina A.

description:
And... another amazing review for Yukol Place. The food is so good that I can't stop eating it and have to force myself to put it away. 

The Pad Kee Maou is ridiculously delicious. It is actually addicting. Once you start eating it you can't stop until it's all gone... and the portions are huge! 

The Pad Thai is amazing as well. They give you both shrimp and tofu and tons of it! 

They are also the most reasonably priced Thai restaurant in the area. Thai is one of my favorite foods in the world and Yukol is definitely the best place to get Thai food!
author: Beth H.

description: I've been to Thailand, absolutely love Thai food and this place is up there with the best I've ever had. Ordered delivery and less than 20 minutes later had some of the most delicious green curry chicken ever. Loaded with chicken and veggies and came piping hot, excellent flavor. Been very disappointed with so many other Thai spots I almost gave up on finding a place in SF. Definitely try Yukol Place!
author: KC D.

description:
I hate to write a not good review after all of the good ones I read. 

I have had a lot of real Thai and a lot of American Thai and this was def American style Thai. Should have known based on the location, but it has so many good reviews. Should have know based on the location though.

The beef fried rice which is a core Thai dish was bland and a little dry, The pad thai was not great either. Flavor not really there.. Noodles clumped together. The yellow chicken curry was nice. The spring rolls were pretty good too, but the two main dishes were not good.

If you have eaten real Thai, I don't recommend this place. If you are really hungry and happen to be standing next to it then, give it a try.

Oh, they also took one hour to bring the food to Pac Heights.

So far the tastiest Thai I have had in SF, and to be honest I haven't had much, is Best of Thai noodle in the Haight. I ate there with my Thai friend who enjoyed it as well.
author: Claudia O.

description:
Sunny: Craving Thai food one night, we decided to order from Yukol. For 2 people, ordered green curry with a side of rice, garden rolls, and pad thai. We asked for these to be extra spicy. They arrived in ~40 minutes, with delicious smelling, piping hot thai food. The pad thai was the best I have tasted, and the curry with coconut milk was to die for!!! Absolutely delicious! The garden rolls came with a dip, and was still very crispy and hot. Overall, I absolutely look forward to eating these dishes again. 

Nolan: I have been looking for a good Thai place since I moved to San Francisco, I was so happy when we tried Yukol Thai!  I have found an amazing local thai restaurant.  The pad thai and green curry were delectable.  The serving sizes were more then ample.  We were outside of their delivery range however they were still kind enough to deliver and the food was piping hot when it arrived.  We plan on getting the pad thai again and trying the red curry chicken.
author: SunnyandNolan E.

description:
Sawaadee Kap, Yukol. 

This is the best Thai food I have had in SF in 12 years of living here. I had seen this place on Lombard a few times but never realized it was so good. In my opinion it was much better than Lemongrass, Pad Thai, Gaittiip and a few other unremarkable places I had tried around town though admittedly I have not been to any of those in the past two years. 

Yukol has a very clean and serene interior with a distinctive Thai architecture feel to the building entrance. The service on a Sunday evening (few patrons) was fantastic and they literally filled our water glasses after every 1-2 sips and served multiple scoops of rice for us so needless to say they were extremely attentive though I do not know how the service would fare on a busy night (assuming they have those). 

I give Yukol 4 1/2 stars for taste/service/ambiance and 3 1/2 for value since the portions are just a bit small and sometimes the shrimp content in a dish is low (like 2 shrimps in the appetizer), though the prices are reasonable at $10-12 per med-small dish. 

For something different and delicious try the Meekrob appetizer #7 (crispy noodles with chicken, shrimp and tofu mixed with a sweet and sour sauce). Yum. [Update note: This appetizer dish had more oil than I thought and although delicious I had an oily after taste for several hours after so go easy on the portions if you try it.]

Also amazing was the #24 House dish with eggplant, chicken, and shrimp. We also had the Pork Pad Krapow (#34) and while also good it was too similar to the eggplant dish so I probably should have ordered a curry or something more unique. 

I should note that all 3 dishes were a bit on the oily side though not as bad as many of the other Asian restaurants around town. I did not really see huge pools of oil or anything but I did notice an oil aftertaste that I had about 30 minutes after I finished eating so people may want to save that after dinner chocolate mint. 

Our total for the 2 entrees, brown rice, and the appetizer with 1 sweet Thai tea was $36 plus tip which seemed reasonable given the quality/taste/service and small amount of leftovers. 

I will definitely be going back to this place next time I am craving Thai food.
author: Mike L.

description:
My review haiku:

Close to BATS improv!
When these people say spicy
They really mean it
author: Austin M.

description:
After checking out several Thai places in the Bay area, this is the best so far.  Each item was very good.  If you like yours a little spicy, be sure to ask for it.  Appetizers were outstanding and the portions were large.  The entree' portions were not huge however.  Service was very good.

Perhaps the best indicator was the fact that there were a lot of regulars who got very happy (and quiet) when their food arrived.  Based on conversations overheard, its perfectly acceptable to go off menu and ask for special preparation of your meal.
author: J T.

description:
We came here for Father's Day dinner and everyone LOVED it!.  It's now our favorite Thai restaurant in the city.    Great food, excellent service!  What more can you ask for?

We started with these appetizers:
1) Tom Yum Gong sum - Right balance of tart and spiciness
2) Two of a kind - fried tofu and fried taro root; tofu was under seasoned but the taro was yummy!
3) Grilled eggplant salad  - Flavor was great and the dressing was a little tangy which was appetizing, but it was a little bit too salty if you eat it with too much of the dressing

For entree we had:
1) Green curry w/pork - liked the consistency, some places make it too watery or too thick.  This was just right
2) Red pumpkin curry w/chicken - again, curry was great consistency.  we were surprised that this was spicier than the green curry which is typically spicier
3) Pad thai - BEST WE HAD IN YEARS!!!  Right balance of tanginess from the taramind and the noodles were great texture, al dente
4) Black pepper quail - This was OK, couldn't taste the black pepper
5)  Crispy snapper w/green beans - Liked the flavor of this dish, would have liked to have a couple more pieces of fish

For dessert, we had the mango sticky rice which was decent.  We also had 3 beer for a total of $130 which includes tips already.  Pretty good deal!
author: Irene C.

description:
When I moved to San Francisco back in 2002 one of my first goals was to find my new favorite Thai spot. It turned out to be a pretty difficult feat. There are a TON of Thai restaurants in the city, and I tried quite a few of them before I happened upon Yukol Place. After having my expectations dashed time after time I was thrilled to find this little gem. 

The dining room is intimate yet comfortable, and it's very clean. The staff is friendly and attentive. And the food, made from quality ingredients, is incredibly flavorful. I mean, really... it's DELICIOUS. I'm not an expert on authentic Thai cuisine, but I do know what I like. The only real knock on the place is that it could use a broader selection of dishes to choose from. The menu is just a little bit limited, but what they do they do well. 

Yukol isn't as cheap as some of the other options in town, but you get what you pay for and really, it's not that pricey all things considered. Hands down, this is my favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Don W.

description:
Amazing food. The larb gai and octopi salads to die for.
The panang curry is great as well.
author: Steph S.

description:
I'm confused how this restaurant is a 4 star restaurant on Yelp.  Its solid, but I think of 4 star places as pretty darn good places, and I don't see this place as any more than average.

I've had take out 3 times and have dined in once.  

Pros:
* dine in, as usual, is a better experience.  Things don't glop together as much and the crispy stuff stays crispier.
* Angel Wings - these are pretty good.  It would be nice if the portion was a little better.  its solid, not great though.
* service dining in is attentive and the staff is friendly
* they deliver - which is a nice bonus

Cons:
* a lot of dishes are similar and not distinctive.  
* the menu is fairly standard - you can get the usual Thai standards.  I guess that's a positive from a certain perspective (not mine though.)
* personally, I've sampled maybe half their menu and I've not found one memorable dish that makes me come back.

I guess that's my whole problem with them being a 4 star restaurant.  There's not one signature dish that I really was impressed by, nor does it represent a tremendous deal or anything.  it just blends in with the rash of so-so Thai food in this town (there are few better than mediocre, but that's another review.)  I guess most yelpers have lower standards.
author: Dave H.

description: This is the best Thai delivery place in the area.  Dishes have great flavor and a good amount of spice.  It's affordable and delivery is fast!  My favorites are the Kaeng Dang (Spicy Red Curry) and Phrik Khing Gai Kung (Spicy Shrimp and Chicken with Veggies).
author: Christa S.

description: By far the best Thai in the Marina.  Super fast delivery and consistently good food.
author: Jacqueline G.

description:
I give this place three stars for the following reasons:

2 stars for awesome food, it really was delicious. truly well done.

1 star for atmosphere and price, super inexpensive for what you get, and its definitely a decent place of food. and the surroundings are well decorated.

BUT

I take away 2 stars for the absolute worst service EVER. I dont know if they were under staffed or didnt anticipate it being busy on a thursday night at 730-8 pm, but it was abysmal, do not plan on getting anything in a timely manner, or asking for anything like drink refills, etc.
author: Lauryn S.

description:
The food is SO much better than Osha, and much more reasonably priced. It's a local mom & pop, so there's that to tug at your heartstrings.

We had the coconut milk soup, which as someone else said is the best I've ever had in SF. Also had the panang curry; again, one of my favorites, and the best I've ever had. Pad thai was great, not too strong of a fish sauce flavor. We also had the phrik khing gai kung, which was prawns, chicken, green beans, mushrooms, red peppers, and tomatoes in this sweet-sour-spicy curry sauce (no coconut milk). That was probably the highlight of the night, my boyfriend WAY overate and nearly finished that dish. 

One star removed because, while very polite and kind on the phone and in person, we were not given an option to pay with a credit card. When the delivery person came to the door and I held out my card, they said, "Ohhhh. I won't be able to give a receipt, I'll have to make a slip on this one." When I said I wasn't asked on the phone how I'd be paying (they just said thank you and hung up), they said, "Oh yes, because we prefer cash." I don't want to say it's sneaky, because they totally took my card, but that kind of omission isn't going to do anything but annoy the customer. But like I said, very nice and polite on all fronts. So if you order from them (and you SHOULD!) be sure to tell them you're paying with a credit card before they hang up.
author: Sheri B.

description:
I was in search for a new Thai restaurant because my favorite one closed down more than a year ago. Tony V. brought us to Yukol and this is now my place to go the next time I have a craving.

I HEART all the appetizers:
* Fried Corn Cakes "Tod Mon Kow Pod" - it is corn & fried...what's not to love?
* Chicken and Beef Satay w/ peanut sauce - good balance on the spices
* Buttercups "Katong Tong" - omg....crispy cups filled with garlic shrimp, chicken, and curried veggies
* You and Me Rolls - off the menu fried rolls wrapped w/ rice noodle....very good indeed
* Adam and Eve Salad - similar to papaya salad but w/green mango, apples & prawns...also off the menu with great flavors
* Green Papaya Salad "Som Tom" - this was good but I think I liked Adam and Eve more b/c it was a tad too spicy
* Spicy Prawn Soup with Lemongrass "Tom Yum Goong" - I like the amount of tartness...mmm

Was full from above but still really enjoyed:
* Fried Snapper Fillets w/ Green Beans & chili paste "Chu Chee Pla Crobb" - like the snapper fried and with the sauce
* Panang Beef Curry - sliced beef w/ carrots & mushrooms...beef was a bit over cooked b/c so thin but curry was great
* Pad Thai - good solid dish
* Pad Kee Mao - similar to Pad See Ew w/ thick rice noodles but  w/ basil and chili...wasn't as spicy as I preferred but still good b/c I love noodles

Round of thanks to Tony V. again for the introduction and the friendly staff there!
author: Katie K.

description: Great Thai food and very attentive service. We left feeling so full we actually needed some time to digest before dessert at Ghiradelli.
author: Dave R.

description: Delicious pad Thai...not overly MASSIVE portions like I'm used to. Pleasant staff which is a nice change from the restaurant I checked out yesterday. If I was a local this would definitely be my go to Thai spot!
author: Rachael C.

description:
Ive always thought the food here was alright, not really really good but not that bad...

not that bad until one night...while I was hanging out with Tim he ordered food from Yukol. He loves this place..anyhow though he let me eat this shredded meat dish..I think you eat with lettuce and wrap up the meat in it...doesnt matter..I also had a rice dish..

Anyhow, I thought their was a funny sour smell with that shredded meat dish... but sometimes thai food has that smell...I should of listend to myself the first time. So..ate my food..hung out with Tim and went home. 

That night, while I was sleeping I woke up with incredible pain in my stomach..I ran to the bathroom and well..lets just skip the details..
and say that..I had fluids coming out from both ends.. AT THE SAME TIME!!!

NOT A PRETTY SIGHT...so from that day on..Ive never really wanted to go eat Thai food..just the sound of it makes me cringe...Ive only been to one Thai place after this incident and that was Chabaa....even then I was still shakey..
author: phillip w.

description:
I eat here about once a week! Their curries are great, its cozy inside, and it just feels fresh, for a good price! Their service is great also!
I also like their appetizers, and soup! Basil chicken and noodles!
author: Jo L.

description:
Finally my SF Thai food quest is over!  

The pad see ew is made with authentic thick noodles, not the fettucine sized ones that most other Thai places serve.  The level of spice is perfect without being overbearing.  The spring rolls are more crispy than greasy.  Prices are looow, service is friendly, great lunch specials. 

I heard that they deliver too -- wow, first time I've ever wanted to live closer to the Marina.
author: Abby M.

description:
Really really solid thai food.  I'm not a big thai person, but this place is really good.  It's the little details in the food that really showcase the stellar quality of this place.  For example, the vegetables are cooked just right -- not too raw and not too well done.  Prawns are fresh and shelled all the way to the end of the tail.  Dishes are well seasoned, but balanced; not too sweet and not too salty.  Pricing is very reasonable -- roughly $8-10 per dish.

They have a mango sticky rice dessert that sounds totally awesome, but didn't get a chance to try :(
author: Andrew C.

description:
Came here tonight with the boyfriend and was craving thai food! I had yelped thai food in the marina and I was torn between trying Yukol and Tom Yum for the first time...I went with Yukol. 

The ambiance of the restaurant when we walked in was very warm--the employees greeted us instantly and the restaurant was quiet. We ordered the Tom Yum soup and pad thai and both were simply delisssh!! The soup was just perfect--the right amount of sweet to sour! (It's been tough to find good tom yum soup in SF) and the pad thai was super yummy as well. We didn't try dessert but will definately come back to try the fried banana with ice cream. Yum!
author: Joy A.

description: Excellent Thai food. I'm a fan!..and I love the fact that they deliver. One of my favorite dishes is the Pad Woon Sen  (#55) Yummy. I wish I had some tonight.
author: Jade C.

description: So good... SF must be spoiled for great Thai if this isn't 5 stars every time, it destroys any Thai I've had outside of SF or NYC, and approaches the sainted SriPraPhai in Queens... Goodness, please move your restaurant to Denver! We had the Tod Mon (#3, fish cakes) to start, really good, and a sign of things to come. Then shared the Pad Kee Maou (#21-- sauteed rice noodles with chicken and shrimp in chili garlic sauce), Moo Kra Tiam (#39 -- thinly sliced pork), and Kaeng Panang (#29, penang curry). I'm not  a very good carnivore, so the revelation of the meal was the Moo Kra Tiam, simply some of the most flavorful meat I've ever had. I would never have ordered it, but so glad that our friend did (her family is from Thailand, and she knew what she was doing!). The Pad Kee Maou was also amazing (a bit like drunken noodles). The penang curry was also good, though not stratospheric like the other dishes. The atmosphere was also nice and what I like in a place, laid back, with more of an authentic family run feel to it, with really sweet and attentive staff. Just a really nice dinner at the end of a really nice day in SF...
author: Jimmy C.

description: I was dragged to this place by a hungry dining companion who always does her homework when it comes to food, so I should have known it would blow my mind. Given her intense foodie focus, I might even have predicted my appetite would be sparked just by the descriptions of the food by our super lovely server (who turned out to also be the talented chef!). We ate some delicious appetizer in little fried shells stuffed with curried potatoes and peas which was so, so tasty. Then terrific BBQ chicken and a seafood dish in which the scallops and cuttlefish were cooked to perfection. The chef proudly served my dining companion a couple pieces of pork which apparently had been marinated for a day or so. At this unexpected and apparently delicious treat, my companion was salivating and clearly regretting having brought me to this fine establishment, as I'm not into consuming mammals, so couldn't appreciate the deliciousness of this magical pork. I so wanted to try more dishes and will absolutely return soon--famished and ready to eat.
author: Corinne B.

description:
Yelp 4.5 star average.. really? Zagat 24 food... really?? We must have stumbled into the wrong restaurant..

Server-recommended special mango-apple salad was borderline edible - the taste and arrangement was somewhat creative but the prawn meat was NASTY. Bland taste and disgusting texture - chewy and dry (way way way overcooked or just nasty meat?)

Chicken green curry was also baaaad - one of the only times I haven't finished a meal. Lots of chicken, but super dry and tasteless. Curry itself was passable. 

Pad thai again borderline disgusting; soaked through and through with oil, the same nasty prawns, unimpressive tofu.

Both of us had upset stomachs the whole night because of this meal. One star with no hesitation. Despite the food, good service.
author: Rob G.

description:
I can't believe I haven't written a review on this restaurant yet. Maybe it's because there are already 110 reviews. However, I have been coming to this restaurant since 1992 since it was around the corner on Scott St. I moved to the East Coast for 8 years and have eaten at hundreds of Thai restaurants, and nothing compares to Yukol Place. 

My favorites have changed over the years. Back in the day, my father and my main staples were #11, #12, #24, #28 (just had #11 recently again, and it's still amazing!) Now, my husband and I tend to go for #3, #14, #26, #50. The fried bananas and coconut ice cream are fantastic (they make the ice cream there). I hate to admit they have a weakness, but once, about 4 years ago, I ordered a beef dish (don't remember which one), and the beef wasn't very good. Not sure if it was an off day, or what, since I never order beef anyway.

Yukol, the chef/owner, is really sweet and comes out often to greet her customers.

One last comment: bring back the tapioca pudding!
author: Jiga M.

description: Yum yum! Pad see ew! I can totally live off of it! Great service too!!!
author: Jamie S.

description: Consistently good thai food for its value. My boyfriend lives nearby so we frequently get take-out or delivery from Yukol. Their curry and noodles dishes are consistently good. Service was a little slow and the waitresses were a little awkward for my liking. The atmosphere of the place is quiet and slow so it's not a place for a romantic date or a dinner before a girls night out. All in all, good neighborhood thai restaurant.
author: Hannah N.

description: This place has delicious homey thai food. Its definitely comfort for me here. Green Curry, pad see yew and pad thai all delicious. I love coming here on a chilly foggy night for a night hot meal. I like that it's half the price of OSHA and tastes more homemade too
author: Shivani S.

description:
Quick seating, delicious and inexpensive!  Went here on a Wednesday and the place was half full.  Four of us had 7 or 8 things and one drink and the bill was $70.

The coconut soup is some of the best I've ever had.  The green curry with duck, my thai food barometer, was very good though not special and not as good as Osha.  Everything else was high quality and tasty.   Service was a little slow but overall a good experience.  Not a place to go out of your way to travel to, but if I were a local I'd get takeout here often.
author: Matt S.

description:
Not impressed with the vegan selections, almost all of which contain fish sauce or egg.  I ordered the sweet and sour tofu, which was soggy and tasted too heavily of tomatoes.  My GF loved her vegetable soup, which to the waitresses credit they made without chicken broth.  

The decor and service were fantastic, but I've had way better thai food in this city.  The prices were average.
author: Craig R.

description: Not much of a fan of Thai food, but we were in SF and needed a place to eat. My uncle was wanting to eat asian food and he came all the way from the land of the Aussie. The 11 of us with two kids pile into this small restaurant. The lighting was so dim I could barely see anything. We finally sat down and started ordering. Everyone looked to me to order so I placed four dishes with two of each dish. The food was very good, but it didn't look like it was going to fill up 11 adults with two kids. Sure enough it did and we even had left overs to bring home. The bill came out to be $220. =O_o=. Only once in a lifetime.
author: Anthony R.

description:
this place isn't packed on a monday night at 9pm.

the you and me rolls are delicious. the soup was also wonderful.  the pad thai was pretty normal pad thai, and the yellow curry with chicken came with a quarter chicken instead of chopped up bits of chicken.

overall i had a good time, i'd go back or even grab some takeout from here.
author: Ameer N.

description:
Sue (waitress with short hair) is wonderfully attentive. The pad thai is awesome (screw Osha!!!! ) and so are the curries.

Lunch specials are very reasonably priced; the blueberry mustard dressing with caramelized toasted almonds are SUCH a wonderful touch.

I think on Friday afternoons there is an additional waitress (longer hair) who is not as competent as Sue.... but the food is consistently good, so I go to Yukol at least once a week.
author: dj z.

description: This place is awesome. Good classic Thai food that is not too greasy. I have never had anything here that I didn't like. Gotta try the Plah Pla Muek. Best of all, the staff here is super friendly. When eating in they don't rush you and delivery is always prompt and correct.
author: Henri G.

description:
This is the best Thai experience I've had. The waitresses were all incredibly nice and attentive. The food here was great. I had the Larb (great), the Roti (awesome) and the Garden Rolls (great) for starters. I then had the Three Amigos (I know it's funny to get a spanish named dish in a Thai place) which was phenomenal. The taste was fantastic. The tea was great; everything was really just great.
My father had mentioned to the waitress that my wife had just graduated from medical school, so they gave us a special treat. We were all very touched. I recommend Yukol Place to everyone.
author: Erik S.

description:
Meh - I have recently moved to the city from Emeryville and was excited for the plethora of food options in the city. I can only compare to the Gourmet Ghetto places in Berkeley which are pretty decent, but my experience here was nothing to rave about.

Prompt phone service - good tip about your Credit Card from previous yelper. Over 1 hour delivery due to rain (I'm lazy I could have walked there, so they win for feeding me!) but this was explained to me - very helpful phone service, with accuracy.

Pad thai, yellow mild curry, rice, and Tom Kha Pak (veggies in coconut peanut sauce) none seemed to have much flavor. The curry was separated so it was an oil and watery base with chicken and a few potatoes - it could have used some carrots and onions, though the chicken was unbelievably tender! Mushy rice, pad thai is not the best  as the others explain, not sure what's up with that. Enjoyed half my plate and left it. Usually I'm going for seconds. 

Reheated a quick plate for lunch the next day, and well, it was actually better. I thought this was only the case with pizza!
author: Sara G.

description:
One of my fav Thai restaurants in the Marina, SF and Bay Area!

The ambiance is very traditional Thai when you walk in as the staff is decked out in traditional garb. They are super friendly and cool. The restaurant is really clean and there are always fresh flowers in vases. I love that!

Hmm...onto the food.
The Appetizers are d-e-l-i-c-i-o-u-s! 
My favs are:
Duck Larb
Todd Mon Kow Poad -Fresh corn mixed with ground chicken, fried
Katong Tong - Crispy little butter cups filled with garlic shrimp, chicken, and curried
* don't miss the butter cups, I don't know too many places that serve this in the area....they are to die for!
Soups
You can't go wrong with the Tom Yum Goong. Make sure you get the seafood one..and of course SPICEY!
Dishes
All the curries are excellent and the perfect consistency - not too thick and very flavorful.
My two fav dishes are -
The grilled pork and the crispy fillet snapper with green beans.

I love how the produce is so fresh at Yukol. You can always count on really fresh veggies. The cucumber salad is mmm good.

Always check out the specials. They had a soft shell crab special on there once and it was amazing. The desserts are also incredible. Mango with sticky rice....yum. Oh, and the Thai iced tea is just right. Not too sweet..not too creamy.

The staff is incredibly kind and patient. We were once there with a large group and several members of the party were a bit loud. The staff was really cool even though some members of our group might have been annoying and even a bit disruptive.
author: Vanessa W.

description:
This isn't Osha Thai.  This is the real deal.  If you want to feel like you have walked into someone's home for some authentic thai this is your place.  The atmosphere is simple, but the food is spectacular.

The curry is fantastic, but if you are still a Thai virgin you'll enjoy the Pad Thai as well (the california roll of thai)

If you are on Lombard (or even if you're not) and craving Thai - don't miss this spot.
author: Sara Ann S.

description:
Mango sticky rice dessert. Amazing.

Food was good, but I most certainly remember the dessert most.

Nice decor and very homey. I like that.

Service is amazing. Really amazing.

Need I say more?
author: Dolores L.

description:
We order out once a week from here!!  It is sooo good.  Tom Yum Soup, Pad Thai, Eggplant special with chicken and shrimp.... YUMMY!  The Curry is fantastic also! 

The restaurant is great also!  Great atmosphere and friendly fast service!
author: Cristof E.

description:
We've always liked Yukol's Place.  Definitely one of our fav Thai restaurants in the bay area.  I find dishes here more unique than your average Thai restaurant.  We LOVE their appetizers, which usually takes up half the dishes on our orders.  Here's a list of what we usually order -

* U & Me Roll - rice noodles covering spring rolls with yummy veggies inside
* Corn Cakes - Yummmm!  Very sweet corn w/some batter made into cakes that are approximately 3" in diameter.
* Buttercups - Absolutely must-have!  Little pastry cups with diced pork/veggies inside.  
* Sliced pork & beef dipped in green chili sauce - There's a beef, and a pork dish.  Both are very yummy.  The pork one tastes a little like pork jerky.  The chili sauce hits the spot!
* Fried fish with string beans on top 

Staff there is very nice and attentive.  Pricing is not bad at all at $11-30/person.  We've been here with big parties, as well as with friends w/kids.  They're always so sweet and accommodating.  

For those of you who haven't been here, we definitely recommend you to check it out!
author: Christine C.

description: I've ordered from Yukol from years and it was only last week that I dined in.  I had family in town and we wanted to do something relaxed.  To my pleasant surprise, the restaurant had a wonderful atmosphere.  Fun and lively Thai decorations and great presentation for their food.  What's more is everything we ordered was excellent!
author: Susie B.

description: Hidden in a small location, this Thai gem is worth the hunt! The food is very authentic and pleasing to your taste buds! We tried 7 different dishes and they were all very divine! Prices are reasonable and service is great!
author: linh d.

description:
I've totally forgot about Yukol.  It's actually a favorite for one of my girlfriends and only discovered it when we went to Yukol for her bday last year.

The duck salad is awesome, nice and spicy but very refreshing.  We also had some fried appetizers, which included taro and that was really good too.  I do have mention that the service is very intimate, the decor of the restaurant is very lovely.  It's sort of a small restaurant and it appears people make reservations, but we've never had a problem getting seated.

The chicken curry and the garlic pork (at least I think this is it) is awesome.  Grilled pork can be dry, especially when it's thinly sliced, but it always comes out juicy and the flavoring is just right.  This isn't one of those Thai restaurants where I come to order something over rice or a noodle like pad thai or pad see eww, it's simply better than that.

I'm glad I saw this on Yelp, will try to make a visit to this restaurant sometime soon.
author: Winnie L.

description: Don't bother with this place.  It's a bit expensive and the food wasn't good.  We order the BBQ Chicken.  The chicken was flat and they put some weird sauce over the chicken.  Sometimes I thought I was eating crushed egg shells.  I'd go back if I was starving, they're the only place open and I had no gas.
author: Joan K.

description: Your standard average thai restaurant.  Good food, good service, and cheap.  My friend and I split phad thai and the spring rolls.  Both quite delicious!  Plus, I really like the water glasses they use.
author: Mary S.

description:
Every time I try a new Thai place in the city I find myself comparing it to Yukol Place.  And Yukol place always wins.  I'm always impressed by the quality and consistency of the food, which is delivered at a reasonable price point.  

Delivery is also above par.  Exceptional packaging, which makes a huge difference.  It's obvious that care is being taken to get the food to you in the same condition that you would expect if you were eating in their dining room.  

5 stars, two thumbs way up, after 20 or so experiences I'm thoroughly impressed.
author: Andrew L.

description:
I had to yelp this after I noticed my dear roommate (and elite yelper) Kaylan wrote hers.
This place is sooooo good, fresh, and savory! Their mango and shrimp salad comes with apples tossed in a light dressing which makes me forget Im eating take-out. I have to agree with other reviewers, their peanut sauce is delish! Basil chicken with brown rice, oh so good!
Great for take-out and the ambiance inside is quaint, however Ive never sat down and ate at the restaurant. Very impressed with this place, it rivals Osha now for me (which I love as well)!
author: Heather S.

description: Good service, great food. My go-to neighborhood Thai place. Recommend drunken noodles. I always dine in for the above average ambiance (for a Thai place).
author: Sally N.

description:
This has been the best meal we have had in SF this trip. We went for lunch and $22 bought the two of use: 
- salad w/ hot and sour soup 
- salad, 2 veggie spring rolls, excellent cup of coconut milk soup, and great noodles w/ Asian broccoli and prawns. 

The service was great too. It is pretty w/ some Thai textiles inside. We're fans. And it was in walking distance from our hotel. Darn great all 'round.
author: Ahava Y.

description:
The food here is really good, and the service is friendly and prompt.  I dig the interior, although sometimes, places decorated like this make me afraid to visit often because it feels like an event coming here.  OK, that's not necessarily true, as Bai Som Thai is decorated similarly and I don't feel uncomfortable walking into there.

OK, so the food is good.  The service is good.  Nice vibe on a hit-or-miss part of Lombard.

UPDATE:  7/2/12
=============

Unfortunately, I must issue a GRATUITOUS-MEAT ALERT for Yukol Place.  I understand that the VEGGIE'S section of the menu says that diners should alert their server if they cannot eat chicken broth, oyster sauce, and fish sauce.  Thanks for the warning, but when I alerted our server, she said the only items on the entire menu that could be made without fish sauce were Nos. 21 and 55.  Two items out of dozens?  Fine, except that neither of those items is listed under VEGGIE's, so it's a real possibility that the chef will be so focused on not using fish oil that he'll forget to hold the meat that normally comes with both dishes.
author: John S.

description: Great Thai food and friendly folks.  Superior neighborhood place.  The "You & Me" rolls are wonderful also basil chicken!  Not expensive.  Great for before or after another event or for tourists who are staying in the neighborhood.  Very close to "trendy" Chestnut St., but quieter.
author: Gina H.

description:
Just had some simply scrumptious Pad Thai here during lunch. Great portion for lunch and to-go. Good prices. I love that they give you the warm noodle,tofu,scallion, peanut , your choice meat etc.mixture and then leave the sprouts crisp,cold on the side for you to mix in with the wedge of lime.

I've been on a lime kick lately, maybe it was all those caipirinhas when I was in Brazil..
author: Tera M.

description: Delicious, cozy, inexpensive. Recommend the green & red curries, as well as the pad thai. Will return!
author: Ali G.

description:
I used to come here frequently many years ago and was there again for the first time after 3 years last Friday. Nothing has changed. The food is still excellent and the service friendly. There were some authentic Thai people dining in the restaurant, which is always a good sign. 

We had Pad Thai, chicken with Japanese eggplant, and Red Curry with chicken - all of which was filled with excellent flavors. 

I also liked that my eggplant dish didn't swim in a pool of grease as it does in many other places. 

I would highly recommend that you give this place with modest decor a try. I think you'll find it to be a good experience.
author: Jana C.

description: This place is great. The service is very friendly and I love how they don't "nickel and dime" you to death - I ordered too much food so I decided to take home the leftovers. I asked for a little peanut sauce on the side (because I did manage to polish that off during the first go-around) and the very nice waitress put some in at no charge. This is what I'm talkin' about people!! - more restaurants need to do this type of thing. What did that cost them ? - $0.02 ?? - next to nothing basically - but what did it do? - made me a loyal customer. Other restaurants take note - throwing in a free bottle of beer once in a while, a free side of hollandaise sauce, some extra peanut sauce with a take-out order ---- that's what helps you build a loyal clientele. Know what I mean??
author: Ashleyanne T.

description: Been here a few times, mostly getting take out. The food is awesome here. The Pad Thai and the Angel Wings are to die for! The only complaint i would have would be the actual service. It seemed a little slow, and i noticed that people who arrived after me were served first. Still a fan of this hidden jem. i will defiantly be going back!
author: Vanessa A.

description:
I love Thai fat noodles with chicken and basil with enough of a kick that you can still enjoy your food and feel some heat. 

Excellent Thai food, the service was friendly and accommodating. 

Lunch specials were reasonable and it includes a small salad with the most delicious sweet toasted almonds.  

Only downer, when you have to pay a ridiculous 25cents for a lousy 10 minutes on a meter.  Eight quarters  only gives you and 1 hr and 20 minutes.  Pbbbfffftttttt.........!!!
author: Jenn A.

description: Awesome service and great thai food, prices are good too
author: Monica A.

description: Maybe we ordered the wrong stuff, but the vege green curry was too spicy and actually had fish sauce in it, and the Chinese broccoli was bitter and tasted weird. We didn't like it.
author: Saul F.

description: Best Pad Thai in the city!
author: Mimi C.

description:
Since the closing of Narai, I've been in search of an authentic thai restaurant to satisfy my cravings for thai food. I think I may have just found it.

The interior decor is cozy. I love the painting of the thai lady on the menu. It's simple, yet elegant. If I had that painting, I'd definitely hang it up on my wall. Not sure my wife would agree and that's one reason why we need a bigger house.

The food is what has me wanting to come back for more though. I'd recommend anything on the menu. There wasn't a single dish I didn't like and I came here with three other big eaters, so we ordered quite a few items. Everything was very flavorful without being too salty.

To top off the five star rating, the prices are reasonable and the wait staff is very friendly and attentive.
author: Edward T.

description:
Always order the Panang Curry with Chicken and the Pad Thai with Chicken. Brown rice for two, order one large (especially if your eating with a guy). 
The delivery people are always nice and on time. Love this place!
author: Julia G.

description:
A small group of us hit this joint after a looong late morning on Alcatraz.  Our next stop was Muir Woods, but not before we grabbed ourselves some grub.

We arrived on the late side of lunch, but wow, how nice to get service with a smile.  Was the perfect pitstop.

I had the green curry lunch.  The salad had a raspberry dressing, which didn't seem Thai, but whatever: it was yummy nonetheless.  Hubby had Thai basil chicken.  Food was hot but tasty.  I think all four of us cleaned our plates.
author: Goodbers G.

description:
The best Thai food I have ever had.  A friend introduced me to this place when I lived in the East Bay.  It's was definitely worth the drive to the marina.  Now when I visit the Bay Area I make a point to come here.

The service is always quick and they are always more than willing to accommodate special requests (like no fish sauce for vegetarians).  Their specials always hit the spot, especially the curry corn cakes.
author: Annie J.

description: Best Thai in San Francisco and most representative of what you'd find when you're there.  I assess Thai restaurants by their panang curry and Yukol made the grade.  Fresh ingredients are the key here and they do it well.
author: Will L.

description:
edible, but average. 

the duck curry was really oily and I could not eat the meat at all. I tried to but it tasted really weird and old, like the duck was cooked somewhere else, separate from the curry. 

Stick to chicken or tofu. 
the chicken in my silver noodles and the three shrimp were quite good, but the silver noodles, which I normally LOVE, were below average. 

the green papaya salad--below average and not enough dressing. it's all about the dressing w/ the thai salad's afterall.
..
even the fried prawns app was only average.

I thought the marina had better thai than other parts of the city, but I think I was wrong.
author: shanestar h.

description: I have been coming to this restaurant for almost 20 years, first when it was located on Scott Street btwn Lombard and Chestnut. I have eaten in most of the Thai places in SF, and live in NYC part time, and travel a lot for work and my wife and I have never had better Thai food than Yukol Place.  Their ingredients are fresh and the are full seasoned (not spicy if you ask them but a LOT of flavor).  I have brought dozens of folks to it over the years and they all have agreed that it's some of the best, and in some cases, original Thai places they've been to.
author: Steve M.

description:
3.5 kind of place.  Good Thai food - the Roti was super tasty as was the noodle dish we got (forgot the name but the only one with the flat wide noodles).  The service was excellent.  Prices incredibly affordable -- we got 4 or 5 dishes with drinks (wine for me, Thai tea for him) and dessert all for $50.  
Will def. make trips back here -- apparently I need to try the green curry and since they do take-out it is more than likely that my next Yukol experience will be sometime soon!
author: Katie P.

description:
In my kick this week to yelp a bunch of places I've neglected to yelp, here's another.

One of my friends thinks Yukol is the best Thai place in the Marina/Cow Hollow area...while I'd love to hate on it and say that they got the "Yuk" part correct (because wouldn't that be clever and endearing???), the truth is that the food is solid.

They are nice.  They don't use white meat for the chicken dishes, but will let you substitute all white meat in the order.  

They  have an excellent "MIENG MEE KROB," which in case you've never had, is one of my favorite Thai dishes, and thus, must be one of the best thai dishes out there because I rule.  It's a great appetizer.

My curry dish was not bad. However, other dishes I've tasted were not quite as great.  Why not more stars? Because I'd rather go to Gatip (roughly across the street and a few blocks down from Yukol) or Osha Thai, even though both are less convenient for me.  This doesn't mean I hate you though Yukol...please don't spit in my food or anything.
author: Brett J.

description:
Excellent, excellent thai food. 

Service is very good, atmosphere "casual romantic" - a place to go on a teenth date (if you get up to this many).

I especially like their "Japanese eggplant with chicken". Also, the fried banana is something not to miss at the end of the dinner.

Mmm.
author: ivan s.

description:
Yukol's Place Thai Cuisine


This place is acceptable.   Good, but not great.  I would place it mid-line with Thai restaurants I have been to in North America.  This is "neighborhood Thai."  I would go again, but only if I was near by and only after I had tried other Thai places in the area.  This is not a place to drive across town to visit by any means.

Staff are friendly, décor is mid-line.  Fresh flowers are a nice touch.  Food was good, but I noticed shortcuts in the preparation that told me the kitchen staff were cooking by rote and without any real sense of pride or passion.  I was also told sticky rice was available as a part of dessert only and not with meals.

In sum: Not a place to avoid by any means, but with so many options near by, it is not likely I will go back.
author: C. C.

description:
My mom and I went here for dinner, pretty solid.  First off, in parking-strapped Marina, there is a parking structure right around the corner, which is nice.  

We ordered the egg, lettuce, cucumber, and peanut sauce salad to start that was very good.  Hardly ever do you find a good salad in a Thai restuarant, I mean, sometimes you get the cucumber salad which is nice, but not really what we Americans look for in a salad.  Above dec.

We then had the coconut milk chicken curry soup which was good, not great.  I'd probably try something else next time, as this is a pretty standard fare at all Thai restaurants.  

For the main meal we had one of their "house specials," a pan-fried flour noodle with chinese broccoli, egg, and some good spices.  It was a hot dish, but not too overwhelming that it blocked out the taste of the meal.  

I would definitely come here again, looking to try all their other dishes, as they all seemed really good!
author: Ben K.

description:
I like yummy Thai food.  I like having a calm stomach.  Yukoi allowed me to have both.  I am so happy with my experience, I have to share!

First, I ordered late on a Sunday night.  They not only agreed to deliver after their normal delivery hours, they were nice enough to go out of their normal delivery range for me.  They were here fast, too!  (Ok, so I gave the driver a $10 tip.  What do you think average is?  $5? Am I off?)

Second, the food wasn't canned veggies sopping in oil and overly or under cooked noodles.  Fresh veggies: zucchini, Jullian carrots and green beans; fluffy sticky rice; and yummy flavor.
 
My vegan brother called his dish average.  He said it could have used more flavor.    

I liked the flavor of the yellow curry and the chicken wasn't all fat and nasty chunks.

I always order the pad sew ew as a staple, almost as a matter of principle to measure against the next time I order it.  The veggies were better than almost any other place I have tried here and the tofu was done well, but there wasn't much there.

I wasn't in love with the veggie rolls, but the sauce was nice.

Also, nothing was spicy, but I didn't order it spicy. I guess this is a good thing for people who don't like spice.

Oh, I almost forgot...their website was down so I couldn't order from a menu.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: The Panang and Green Curry are both solid choices.  I can't comment much on the dine-in experience since I've never actually eaten there, but as a take-out connoisseur and frequent visitor I've gotta give Yukol Place 5 enthusiastic stars.
author: Brett N.

description: Had the cashew nut chicken and chicken w/ black fungus which both looked and tasted pretty much the same . Both dishes tasted decent although it seemed to be lacking some flavor .... also , the chicken was overcooked . The #1 crispy rolls which were very yummy though and the thai iced tea was decent .
author: Eileen L.

description:
recommended for takeout - delicious and efficient.

pad kee mao with chicken was one of the best.
author: Josie M.

description: Goodness, mmmmm I had a good experience here, inexpensive, super speedy service, happy worker, while I'm starving... hey hey, can't ask for more!
author: Monika T.

description: We went here last night and everything was great, especially the service. The place was completely full and we were treated very well. The food was delicious and all of the staff was very nice. Will definitely go back if we are in the area again.
author: Matt L.

description: First off I would like to say that Thai food is one of my favorite cuisines. Probably number two on my top five list with Korean food taking a slim lead. So I'm pretty critical about Thai food. I went here during lunch with my cousin who recommended this place. First off, the decor is so charming! It's a small intimate setting, but places like this are my favorite. I ordered chicken green curry and I assumed it would be a really small portion because it was on the lunch menu. OHHH MY GOODNESS. It was not even small at all. The green curry came in a bowl with a side rice and they were not skimpy on the chicken. It was THE best green curry I've had. I cannot even begin to explain my experience to you. Loved it loved it loved it.
author: Megan M.

description:
I thought the food was pretty good, I am a vegetarian and they had a pretty good selection.  I did find that they put a bit too much cilantro in their soup... 

Service was good, food not bad, decor average.

Cheers, 

Andrew
author: Andrew S.

description:
Love it. The sticky rice mango pudding is delish.
Everything tastes great... the best Thai food i've eaten in the city.
author: A T.

description: We visited this place while in S.F. on our honeymoon. Thai food is my fave.....the service was great, the food was yummy, the atmosphere was cute. We loved our stuff. I would go back time & again!
author: Marisa T.

description: Don't know why this had good review, it was close to awful!  Tried angel wings based on reviews, decent but nothing to brag about.  The chicken larb was soaked with fish sauce to the point it's almost inedible (and I LOVE fish sauce)!  The green chicken curry was tasteless except for the hot spice.  The place was too dark. Will not come back here.  So many more better places in the city.
author: Grace M.

description: Solid 4 stars.  These guys take big old pieces of shrimp and fry them up in crispy noodles--  I've never seen this done before and I like it.  Overall, everything was hot and tasty and the ambiance was relaxed and friendly.  Definitely a good affordable choice when you're in the Marina area.
author: Matt L.

description:
Just ordered from here after reading other reviews on Yelp and we weren't disappointed!  

The delivery was fast and friendly.  We had the Tom Kha Gai and crispy rolls to start which were both great.  The green curry was delicious too.  The Pad Woon Sen was good, but just a little boring.  But I look forward to trying the Pad Kee Maou next time which was what I actually wanted but it was not in the 'noodle' section on the website.

We will order from here again.
author: Angela L.

description: After a long day in the city, we were craving Thai, and this hit the spot! The servers were very polite and prompt on filling drinks and taking care of our needs. Very delicious Thai food! The chicken coconut soup was fantastic! The perfect mix of spices, slightly on the spicy side, with warm, robust coconut milk flavor, and chunky pieces of meat, mushrooms, etc. The Pud Thai was very flavorful and didn't have that day old taste that it can get. The atmosphere and decor was a weird mix of "traditional" Thai, but comfortable. We'll definitely go back!
author: Jeromy M.

description: Seriously good Thai food. The special with eggplant, chicken and prawns is just as good as Lemongrass and the service is excellent. When I stop in for take out I have 5 people sweetly smiling and offering tea or water. Very nice people, affordable and a welcoming retreat from Marina crowds.
author: polina S.

description: My friends and I came upon Yukol Place by accident, but we had a great dinner. The food was really good and the service was awesome. The kitchen had run out of the special on the menu, but the chef made something else for us and it was delicious. Our lovely waitress had everything on the menu memorized and gave great recommendations for everyone at the table, even taking allergies and spice preferences into consideration. I loved the red curry chicken dish I ordered. I'd definitely recommend this place for a good, casual Thai meal.
author: Amy N.

description:
I'm in search of my favorite ethnic cusine and so far, for thai this is the spot.
I've had take out twice and both times, everything was deliciious. the green curry, eggplant with chicken, the pad thai, angel wings were all very solid.   

The food was ready, hot and portions are a good size. I also like Osha on Union, but this is better value and probably better tasting.
 
I could give it five stars, but then there is nothing that compares to thai food served on the beaches of Thailand.
author: K L.

description: Since I moved from Brazil to San Francisco I come here often! It's so traditional and real... they have flowers in all tables, classical music in the background, some welcoming goddess facing the door and the service was always great! The food makes me happy, specially the pad kee mao! I plan to come back a lot of times...
author: Marcella N.

description: This place is good.  I was pleasntly surprised by the quality of their food.  The Green Curry sauce was fantastic.  Some good spice and flavor.  I enjoyed all of our dishes and the coccunut soup was not too bad also.  The service was solid and with the check you get mini knockoff peppermint patties which are great.  Reasonable prices and good food.  I will be back.
author: Harry E.

description: Business must be really good when they refuse to deliver only a mile from their location - advise finding a place that actually WANTS customers!
author: Jim K.

description: Yukol has been my favorite neighborhood Thai restaurant for 15 years! The staff is very friendly and the food never disappoints. The mango with sticky rice (and I also order a scoop of coconut ice  cream to go on top) is simply to die for!
author: Angela C.

description: I tried this place based on yelp reviews and it was even better than I had hoped!  I went on a relatively slow Sunday night.  Service was good and the food was excellent!  I am hoping to make this place my go-to for Thai.
author: Chris W.

description: Found this when looking for Thai after Exploratrium closed. Easy several block walk from museum. Prompt service and excellent food. Salmon curry was special of the night and was great. Duck curry equally yummy. Flavorful, appropriate portions and family friendly. Will go back when in the neighborhood.
author: Ken C.

description: This is the place i usually go if i want to sit down and enjoy some thai.  Their curries are awesome (especially the green curry).  I highly recommend the pad kee mao.  It is about a dollar more per entree than a couple other places in the near area, but i think that it is worth the price.
author: Robert R.

description: We come here for lunch often. Not a bad place compared to others in the area.  3 stars for forgetting to put baby corn in a baby corn dish!
author: V s.

description: Like 1 liter of oil and tiny bit of curry? Perfect place for you. At least we got our money back.
author: Fred D.

description: This is the kind of fabulous local restaurant that you look for when you move to a new town or neighborhood.  Friendly service, great food, and a pleasant, if not particularly interesting, environment.  The curries and soups are excellent and the seafood is very fresh.  If you really like your Thai food spicy, make sure you drive that point home clearly and ask for it "Thai hot, not wimpy American hot".  They'll accomodate.  One slight disappointment was their Pad Thai - but since you can get that anywhere, it's not a big loss - could also have just been an off night, so don't hesitate to give them a try.  In the short time I've lived in SF, I've become a regular!
author: Josh M.

description: Nice atmosphere with seemingly random table and wall art, but I wouldn't have it any other way. Staff is super friendly. Good food. I may be a bit biased just because I like the area it's in. It's also nice that theres a public parking structure at the end of the block, even though it may be full.
author: Will T.

description:
I am still waiting for my order of Pad Thai and Pad See Ew...it has been over an hour and a half!! They told us it would take 30-45 minutes...I called them several times, and they apologized and said it would only be another 15 mins. 40 mins later I called once again and told them that I wanted to cancel my order (it was getting very late), and was only told 'sorry about that'. No offer to give us the food for free or anything...

I can't rate the food as I never saw any of it...
author: Paige K.

description:
When I think about eating Thai, Yukol Place is always the first place I think of- it just depends where I am in the city and how long I'm willing to wait to eat while in transit.

I'm not a fan of the restaurant location being right on Lombard street, which makes parking difficult, but the restaurant itself is nicely decorated with traditional Thai paintings and wood carvings. There are never large crowds at the restaurant, which people walking by might think the food's not that great, but it really is.

The menu is traditional Thai and I'm sure you could get many of the dishes at other higher end Thai restaurants, but Yukol just does it so well. I don't remember the names of the three dishes I always get but I believe they're #22, #17 and #36, but don't trust me on that. 

The servers are very friendly and attentive, but not overbearing.
author: Samantha F.

description: For years my buddie has been talking about this place. Well, since it is right around the corner from my house........it only took me like 2 years to get over there. And my friend was right........this place kicks ass. If you love Thai food I don't think you should take the 2 year wait that I did.
author: tom h.

description:
*Updated!*

My first visit only warranted a 3.  The food wasn't great, but decent.  The last visit changed my opinion.  I'm not sure if it is a hit and miss situation, but I'm leaning towards it being a dish selection issue.  

Look & Feel:  The place is not what you would expect from the outside.  It's clean and decorated nicely.  You can definitely show up casual and feel right at home.  

Service:  the wait staff was great.  Water was consistently filled, rice was served, and plates were cleared timely.  The place was not super busy, so that could have been why we received extra attention.  The place started to fill as we left and most customers looked like repeat visitors.  

Food:  I wouldn't consider myself an expert on Thai food, but I have visited many places all throughout the bay area and think I have a good handle on what is top notch.   The marinated beef dish seemed dry, although the accompanying chili sauce was excellent and the flavor was good.  We had the Pad See Maoeu (flat rice noodles) and that was tasty, but was overwhelmed with veggies.  The balance of sweetness was spot on, but it just seemed like I wanted more noodles.  We had to have a curry dish to round things out and the duck got the nod.  As far as the curry goes, it had great flavor.  There was a nice heat to it and felt balanced.  As for the duck, 95% of it was butchered well but I did get a big chunk of ligament which required removal.  I topped off my meal with a hot thai coffee, which came nicely presented.  I'd say this was my highlight of this dining adventure.  Upon my 2nd visit, I had the pad thai, boneless curry chicken w/potatoes, and a corn/chicken/pork appetizer that looked like a deep fried fritter.  All of those dishes were excellent.  The chicken was tender, the pad thai was  not overloaded with fish sauce, and the curry sauce was perfect.  

Pricing:  we got out of there for $45 with tip.  This included 3 dishes, a glass of wine, and my coffee.  For the marina, this is pretty hard to beat.  Unless of course, you go to the other thai place (Gatip).

Stick with the standard Thai dishes and you won't be disappointed.
author: Simon Y.

description: Far and away our favorite Thai place.  Excellent food, great prices, consistent service, lovely decor.  We come back all the time.
author: Beth T.

description: Decent Thai food restaurant. Nothing special. Service was good and friendly.
author: k x.

description: Didn't love the food but it was decent for the price.
author: Scott S.

description: I know...satay is so pedestrian.  But it rocks here.  and the peanut dipping sauce is amazing.  i could have that with rice.  to continue, calamari salad (nice spice), and the thai egg rolls are all great starters.  Went with eggplant and shrimp, seafood claypot, pad thai (because I love pad thai) and beef with red curry.  Everything was GREAT.  there wasn't one thing i'd say was "ehh" about it.  And we were celebrating my husband's birthday, and they presented the cake and even sang.  The people are lovely and so kind.  Attentive service AND great food?!  a definite keeper!
author: Sonia C.

description: I really liked one of the green curries...it was really tasty. I have had better pad thai other places, but the curry was really great. I'd go back to try some of the other dishes.
author: Glaciala A.

description: I love Thai food, and this place is awesome!! It has pretty good prices, especially considering its location. Plus, the food is incredible! I have been here a few times, and every time it has been delicious. The first time we went, it was at lunch, so the atmosphere was very casual. The next time, we went for dinner, and it actually had ambiance! It was romantic and sweet, with candles and dimmed lights. I loved it. It was a great touch and just added to the great food and service. The only downside is parking... once, we wound up driving around for 30 minutes looking for parking. But it's not really Yukol Place's fault that there's no parking... right? Bottom line is, this is top of the line Thai food in SF--if you haven't tried it, you need to.
author: Bridgette A.

description:
SO delicious and good prices. Found the place via Yelp, so thanks to the previous reviewers. the beginning part of dinner would leave one with reservations, but the food turned out so yummy and the bill was surprisingly small that I felt compelled to share my experience and highly recommend that you try it too. 

I went on a Monday around 7pm and the place was deserted except one couple.  There were multiple take-out orders though, but it was upsetting when those customers placed their order after mine but got their food first. 

Another thing, I despise the outrageous charge for rice ($1.50 for white rice  and $2.50 for brown), so I planned on getting a noodle dish to avoid it.
