My husband and his brother got #18 (wide noodles with chicken, shrimp, basil) that they thought were fantastic. I got #21 (chicken, Japanese eggplant, bell peppers, basil) that I thought came with noodles. When I found out it didn't, I asked for some plain thin rice noodles, which I wasn't happy about at first, but found it a worthwhile move in the end. My dish was SO good I didn't want to stop eating. Hope the restaurant would consider making it standard to include noodles with dish #21. 

Overall spent $24 (that included 15% tip) for three people's dinners plus one drink. My order was big enough to have lunch the next day too. Would definitely come back when I'm in SF again.
author: Helen H.

description: Really good neighborhood find.  It's really warm and cozy inside.  Always friendly service.  The seasoned cornish game hen is awesome.  The green curry is nice and spicy.  The beef sirloin in garlic hot sauce is great.  Oh and the Tom Ka Gai soup is sooo good.  They deliver, too.
author: Lauren S.

description: Friendly service, delicious Thai Food. Good for take out or dining in.
author: Mellie D.

description:
4.5 stars

have had delivery from here a few hundred times and have been sooo impressed!! some of the best peanut sauce I have EVER had!! and they make sure and put TONS of it on their salad & pad thai is really good (and great leftover!).
they have perfected their delivery service as they can drop off a couple of thai iced teas with the lids taped so as not to spill, no prob lickity split.
friendly service, A+ peanut sauce, great food!!
i am happy =)
the only bad thing i could say is the tofu was a bit soggy in my salad the other night. =(
author: Kaylan S.

description: To add my $0.02, this place is tasty as the other reviewers write...AND they deliver to my 'hood. KEY. I choose them over the 2 other Thai places within walking distance of my in Lower Pac Heights b/c of taste & portion size.
author: Liz K.

description: I had one of the worst nights of my life here. It was my birthday to boot. Not to blame the restaurant but the our waitress had the exact same voice and intonations as a landlord that evicted me, my boyfriend at the time hooked up with one of my favorite new friends, and the food was mediocre. Not that i could even eat much of it. I did like some spicy shrimp dish but here in the bay Area where there is a Thai Restaurant every block, dont bother coming here.
author: Liz S.

description: I love this place.  The staff are super friendly and courteous.  It's a family owned business that consistently serves up great Thai food and reasonable prices.  They are super friendly and I will go nowhere else for my Thai food.  I have been going there for over 10 years and hope they stay around forever!
author: Channie D.

description: This was the best Thai food I've had in the Bay Area. The waitstaff was very friendly, the food was delivered fast and everything so was fresh and tasty. I think everyone should go there. It was YUM!
author: Jasmine S.

description: I have eaten here so many times since I moved to Northern California that I have lost track. We live over an hour from the city, but make the trek just to eat here. GET THE YOU and ME rolls!! I spelled it wrong, sorry. Everything here is superb and the service couldn't be better. The best Thai food we have had in the bay area!
author: Andrea T.

description: So, I was very excited about this place, hearing good things from my friends and all.  Above the small amount of vegetarian items on the menu there was a disclaimer "please tell wait staff if you cannot eat animal ingredients such as fish sauce, chicken stock, etc. so we can accommodate you." Well everything was made with the fish sauce except about two dishes, which diminished their vegetarian section by about 80%. There were only two dishes that were completely veg! Also, they ran out of tofu! Who runs out of tofu at a thai place? The food was whatevs. Extra star for the yummzy brown rice. So many better Thai places in the city!
author: sirena m.

description:
I like this place. The food is very good, the price is right and the people are incredibly nice and accommodating. 
     I found them while searching through the SF Chronicle ratings. If you haven't noticed there are very few 2 1/2 stars with only 2$$. This is one of them. I have to agree with the Chronicle review. I have brought several friends here and they all rave about it.
   My favorite are their green curry dishes.
author: Stella N.

description: Nuer Ob (the beef with pepper and thai spices) is great! Tasty, tender, and flavorful.  The other dishes I've had, amongst them, green curry beef and the chicken stir fry dishes, are just okay.  The restaurant is casual, oddly decorated and quiet, (usually couples it seems).
author: Ben D.

description:
This place delivered delicious Thai food to our house!  We loved everything, yum.  I will order from Yukol Thai again!

26.   KAENG KIEW WARN - Choice of beef, chicken, or pork in spicy curry with green bean, bamboo shoots, eggplant, cauliflower, zucchini, baby corn and a touch of basil.

32.   GAI PAD KHING - Sautéed sliced chicken with ginger, onions, tomatoes and black fungus.  

56.   PAD THAI - Pan-fried Thai style rice noodles with shrimp, tofu, ground peanuts, tofu, egg and bean sprouts in tamarind sauce.
author: Leah D.

description: We were the first to arrive at 5pm on Saturday right when they opened.  In a matter of 10 minutes, 4 more groups showed up.  This must be a popular place.  The restaurant was very clean and cozy.  The service was on point and the food arrived quicker then expected.  We ordered #53 (sizzling seafood plate with chili sauce $14) and #28 (Duck curry made with coconut milk $11).  I can't explain how good the food tasted.  Very flavorful.  The dishes were big enough for 2 people to share and have some leftovers.  Price was very reasonable for 2 plates and 2 servings of rice ($31).  Location is right off the Golden Gate bridge on Lombard.  I will be back for more of that coconut sauce.  Oh and we asked for a little less spice in our dishes and it came out perfect.  I heard they have pretty spicy food here.
author: nima s.

description: Do not order any of the prawn dishes. The red curry prawn dish came with maybe three prawns and a lot of green beans. Very disappointing.
author: Kim H.

description: This place is damn good for your local thai joint. I am a spring roll junkie (and snob) so I know that I have found a good place when I actually love the spring rolls.
author: Nicole S.

description: Little diamond in the rough. The nicest service, very affordable, appetizers are great, so far everything was great... can't give this place enough praise.
author: Cary Elizabeth L.

description: I've only ever ordered take out from here.  Admittedly, I am not the most adventurous food person, so I claim no knowledge of its authenticity.  But, I really enjoy the pad thai (very flavorful compared to my previous delivery place) and the garden rolls.  Relatively prompt delivery (30 - 60 minutes depending on the time of day).  Friendly and efficient phone service.
author: Jen C.

description:
Yummy yummy Yukol! Oh how I love this place. They have a huge menu chock full of goodness. Their salads are unreal. Everything I've ordered is great. And I wash it all down with a delicious Saketini.

They also do takeout and delivery.
author: Robyn H.

description: I LOVE YOKUL PLACE. The service is always friendly. It is always time to have dinner at Yokul Place. I have been coming to this restaurant since i was a grade school student. This place introduced me to the rainbow of curry. Green, Red, and Yellow curry, all delicious in their own way. My favorite is the duck curry. Angel wings, fish cakes, and the papaya salad are always tasty treats to start your meal. Tom Yum Goong and Pad Thai never fail. Add curry and copious amounts of rice, and you have yourself the most perfect Thai food experience available in San Francisco.
author: Chris L.

description: Yukol's Place Rocks! A friendly place to dine that features good food at an affordable price. The lovely staff always giggle when I speak Thai ... does that mean my Thai is that bad or that good??? We live in the 'hood so we go there regularly for their curries and specials. On a cold foggy night Tom Yum soup warms the body and the soul ... peppery and hot! The food is yummy and the ingredients are always fresh. Sawadee!
author: Felix R.

description: This is a great Thai place.  Nice atmosphere to sit down, but even better if you call and get it to go at home.  Big fan.
author: Dan D.

description: This is one of those places you aren't expecting to be excited by, but end up making it one of your usual places for either dining in or taking out. The combination of low key atmosphere, delicious food, great wait staff, and decent prices makes it my new favorite local spot for Thai food.
author: Beth M.

description:
I love this place. My first experience was during one of the power outages in December. 

It had been a great day: I braved traffic to drive all the way to Half Moon Bay for work. I thought I was going to die but I refused to turn back. I made it through the downed trees, over Devil's Slide-that was shut down later in the day-and got to work to find the power out. No one called to say - "Erin, don't drive 2 hours because the powers out!" Well they couldn't. So I don't fully blame them. 
I got home to enjoy the peace and quiet of the Presidio. I had a great storm day planned out that involved movies, hot chocolate and naps. But alas! I arrived home like a warrior returning from battle to find the power out there too. 
Later that night as the sun went down (was it even out that day?) my roommate and I decided to brave the weather. We rewarded ourselves first at Final Final with a few drinks and then headed towards the Marina to find food. We saw Yukol from far away because of a tree that had fallen across the doorway. There were still a decent amount of people inside despite the obstacles so we settled on Yukol.
The staff was very friendly and prompt. They were kind enough to let us sit down even though half of our group was missing. We held the table for a while without ordering and they didn't seem to mind. I think they could tell we'd nearly been blown away that day.
The food was also fantastic. The medium spicy curry with baby corn and mushrooms was awesome! Their Pad Thai was far more flavorful than most, which was a great surprise. I, like most people, always order Pad Thai and I've been getting bored. But Yukol renewed my love.  Not that I would've stopped ordering it because I've been bored, but it's still nice to know that it can be made right. We also ordered one of their specials. I think it was a lobster spring roll of some sort. The cook came out to say hi and ask how everything was! That's not something I experience too often in Thai restaurants so I was quite stoked.

My love of Be My Guest Thai has been transferred to Yukol. They have it all (unlike some loves that choose to play with my heart) Yukol delivers and has great food!
author: Erin G.

description: My boyfriend had been coming here for years and introduced me to it and i took one bite of their  curry buttercups...i almost fell out of my seat they were so good!  Best duck larb in town too, no joke!  Great service, super friendly staff.
author: Steph S.

description:
The food is delicious -- love their red curry (esp. the Kaeng Pak)!  Also, the family that runs it couldn't be nicer. 

 Came home from work one day, starving and a little cranky.  Took the bus from work to Yukol to pick up dinner and was not looking forward to the longish walk home.  While waiting a couple minutes for the food, got to chatting with one of the women who work there, who asked where I lived, and when she heard, how/where I'd been able to park.  

When she found out I actually didn't have a car with me, she insisted that they give me a ride home when they took the next delivery!   Being exhausted and hungry after a long day at work,  not having to walk home in heels was a dream come true.  And of course, when I got there, the dinner was tasty as ever!
author: Alex Z.

description: Great atmosphere. There are 20 tables and can be busy. Food is vey tasty and very authentic. Price is very reasonable. Will go there again if return to SF.
author: iris c.

description: well, they didn't have my all time fav, Pad Kra Pow (no clue how to spell that), but we did devour some delish Panang Curry with Pad Kee Mao (again don't judge the spelling)... fantastic friendly service and waitress even corrected some of the thai words werer using and taught us some thai swear words!
author: Gabrielle J.

description: Best Thai food my wife and I have ever had...Even though we are not intense Thai food eaters, the Coconut soup just rocks, even according to my wife who doesn't like soup.  Place is a quaint little hole in the wall, parking in the area is difficult at best as is most of downtown SF.
author: Brad M.

description: This was the first Thai delivery restaurant I tried in San Francisco and I haven't tried anything else since! I'm a big fan of Sa Bai Nang (#13) and Pad Ma Keur (#24). Staff is always sincere, always gets my order right and always delivers in the time noted. I really want to eat-in to compare!
author: Heather P.

description: For all practical purposes this is the best Thai restaurant in SF.  Wonderful dishes that appeal to anyone famliiar with authentic Thai food and anyone who like Thai food. This is just a good restaurant. The service is wonderful. The prices are reasonable and the portions are generous. Yukol is a fantastic chef who preseves authentic Thai taste while innovating and appealing to everyone.  The "You and Me" roll is a splendid creation. Arroy mak.
author: Snubby J.

description: Consistently the best Thai food in the city.  Definitely a local restaurant feel (I've had the same waitress every time).  The curries are great and they deliver locally on orders over $15.
author: T H.

description: Too good!!  I like going in there and experimenting with dishes I've never tried before, which is usually a HUGE no-no for asian & thai restaurants.  But somehow, it has paid off every time -- I suggest asking the wait staff for their recommendations.
author: Kevin V.

description: Had the pad see ew dish (named differently on the menu), and the green curry with duck.  Both pretty good in comparison to other thai restaurant in the city, a bit expensive as well, but hey its the Marina so what can you really expect.  Very clean decor and has the feel of a cozy local restaurant, so overall very worthy of a 4 star rating, IMO.
author: Andrew G.

description: just had my birthday dinner here the other day, the mood and lighting was great, pad see eww with tofu was yummy i recommend this place for a date or group festivity
author: Sandy L.

description:
I went to this restaurant last night with my boyfriend and it was some amazing thai food.  I was very pleased with the awesome food and the great service.  Being a Tuesday night we were pretty much the only ones in the restaurant, but they were very attentive to us instead of just ignoring us.  
All the food was great but the shrimp rice rolls we had for an appetizer were amazing.
Overall a great place to eat... highly recommended!
author: Sara M.

description:
We went here last week and it was just as good as the last time we went (2 yrs ago). Aggh life with a child. 

Their food is awesome and oh so fresh. Check the board for their specials. I really liked the fried spring rolls wrapped in a fresh noodle. They had a fried trout topped with green mango...nice and tangy. My other fav is the calimari salad. Not sure how they cook it but it's not fried and not chewy, but rather tendor served with a Thai vinagrette of sorts. Great service. Also try the steamed brown rice instead of the white. It's better for you and tastes great. Best brown rice I've ever had.

They were very nice to my noisy 1 1/2 yr old son (sorry fellow diners), but its not really a place to bring lil' ones since the atmosphere is rather nice and it made me feel rather guilty. They even had a Superman placemat for the boy. Thats just...well...super.

One of my favorite Thai joints. Worth the hunt for parking on Lombard.
author: ant m.

description:
Sick and home alone tonight so I decided to try a new neighborhood thai restaurant for some comfort food: soup and curry. I ordered the Thom Kha Gai soup (vegetarian) and the Kaeng Panang Curry. I specifically requested the curry to be as mild as possible as I can't handle too spicy. 
I started with the soup and I was very pleased with it. It consisted of a variety of fresh veggies and had just the right amount of spice. Next and finally, I moved on to the main course: the curry. I took one bite and immediately felt a burst of fire in my mouth. I couldn't take another bite and my mouth and lips are still burning from the spicyness. :( I am not one to call and complain but I decided to at least call to let them know. I certainly wasn't going to walk back down there and get another but maybe they would offer me a discount or something for next time. I called and was very nice. I said to the girl that answered that it was my first time ordering at the restaurant as I was looking for a new thai spot. I told her that the soup was excellent but although I had requested that the curry be as mild as possible it was fire hot. She apologized, didn't offer me a thing and said goodbye. This was rather dissappointing as at least if they had good customer service I would give them another chance. I am actually full from the soup but I have a whole container of curry sitting before me. What a waste of $19... I won't be going back.
author: Shaida M.

description:
I'm new to town and to yelp but felt compelled to sign up so I could review this place. Our group needed to get some dinner without an hour long wait on a Friday night and one of them had heard of this place. We got several appetizers to share and each got a main dish. I had the #34 (can't remember its real name) and it was absolutely delicious. To top it all off, the service was fast and friendly.

A few nights later, my roommate and I couldn't quit talking about it so we ordered some dishes for delivery, and they were just as good. A word of warning, though, if you ask for something "extra spicy," they won't hold back.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
I had ordered from here as all the reviews were positive.  

I ordered my food at 715pm.  They stated 45 mintues for delivery. At 830, they still weren't at my house.  I called them, and they said they were on there way.  At 845, they arrived.  To say the least the food was very cold.  The delivery woman was nice and apologized for being late.  We ordered the shrimp rolls, pad thai, and the spicky beef green curry with brown rice and 2 diet cokes.  One of the cokes were warm (blah!).  The rolls were cold, so they weren't good.  I'm sure if they were warmer or even hot, they would be tastey.  The curry was great.  I ordered it more spicy, and it was good.  The pad thai was fair.  I've had way better.  

I won't order from here again.  Maybe the food is better eating in.
author: Vicky H.

description: Yummy!  Calamari salad is excellent.   Everything else I've tried is good, whole Pompano with green beans stands out.  The service is very friendly and familiar.  A step up from most Thai spots.
author: The I.

description:
the employees here are super nice. 

i got take out, food was prepared super fast and hot.

food was good, but not the best ive had but still recommended.

place was packed.
author: Ming W.

description: Can't believe I just found this place. Best Thai in the city, hands down.
author: Steve M.

description: The food in this place is so good it brings tears to your eyes. I eat there everytime I am in SF. Several times a visit as a matter of fact. I am not particularly a fan of Thai Food, I like all food types but I just love good food. The Adam and Eve salad here is too good to describe. Perfect is the only word I can think of. The staff is really nice and when I have eaten from their recommendations I have never been anything less than thrilled. Little hole in the wall with great food. Prices aren't bad either. One person can have a great and I mean GREAT meal for less than $20. I am not sure you can get enough at McDonalds for that much anymore. San Francisco is packed with good restaurants but this is my favorite.
author: Doyle O.

description: This place is great, and no longer a secret. As others mention the staff is awesome, and one family I think. My favorites are the Beef Nuer Ob and the Corn cakes are great but you can't really get the latter to go or they'll get soggy.
author: Jeremy R.

description: I've eaten here frequently over the last 4 years and have always loved the food and service, whether dining in or getting it to go.  And yes, I'm very friendly with the staff and Yukol herself, as I've been there so many times.  Sue and Puey are awesome!
author: J C.

description: Simply among the best Thai food places in the entire city.  I used to live around the corner and ate here 2-3 times a week.  Consistently outstanding.  Even though I live in Glen Park now, I still try to visit Yukol as often as possible.  The pad thai is hands down the best in the city (sorry Osha...but it is true).  Don't stop at Go - proceed directly to Yukol.
author: Aaron D.

description: I've never actually eaten at this restaurant, but it's the best Thai delivery I've found in the Marina/Cow Hollow area. I love Thai food, have spent a month eating in Thailand, and have a fairly high bar for Thai food. Compared to the best, I'd give this a three. Compared to alternatives in the area, I'd give it a five.
author: Look and C.

description: not very authentic, delivery was reasonable, price was rather high for simple un-complex, run of the mill thai food.
author: Haoming C.

description: I LOVE their Pad Thai and could eat it every night! (that's why they get 5 stars)! It's quick, easy, and they don't slather their food in oil. I also loved it because I could ask for something to be prepared with less oil. I love the staff. Their Thai food is some of the best around - then again, I usually stick to one thing when I go Thai - Pad Thai. My friends have had other stuff, curry, etc. which they have liked as well.
author: Michelle D.

description:
woo hooo great Thai food in the Marina... just happened to walk by and noticed that it got a good zagat review....of course I didn't notice that was 2003....

meh...it couldn't have gotten that bad now could it? =) thought we'd give a go anyways and well it didn't disappoint. Everything we had was delicious...I ate until I almost exploded. My favorite was probably the yellow curry
author: Joy Y.

description: this is the type of place that serves a lot of starch - rice noodles, rice, & not so much veggies. they're very sweet (the wait staff that is, although come to think of it, the food was too), service was good & caring, but there's only so much they can do to make up for a big fat plate of rice w/ some tofu/shrimp on the side. and i ambitiously got the tom yum - not really sour, a huge full bowl of rice noodles, that swelled up absorbing all broth. i was only there for lunch, and only once, but i won't go back.
author: Kim Y.

description: easily the best thai food in SF.. maybe the bay...  very consistant quality.  most of the staff is genuinely friendly...  they know how to work hot peppers into the  flavor and not just having hot for the sake of hot...  SUE is very pleasant....  everyhting ive had has been awesome....  and ive had A LOT off the menu....
author: Brian D.

description: mmm...yummy....spring rolls, cucumber salad, pad thai, green curry with prawns, tom kha gai soup--everything was great, and the staff was super friendly.
author: Amy K.

description: Upscale and super clean atmosphere. The decorations are top notch, and the bathroom is immaculate. Service is quality, our waitress Pui was super nice! Only came here for lunch, got one of the specials which was cheap and huge. Next time will try dinner!
author: M. W.

description:
yummmmmm. best thai ive had in a long time!

great service, great food, great prices!

the chicken coconut soup is amazing.

All in (with tax and tip) $60 for 1 appetizer, soup, 2 entrees, and 4 beers.
author: Kay T.

description: Very good Thai food for the price.  My favorite place in the neighborhood, particularly for delivery.  The tom-yum soup is quite good and their curries are excellent too.  Yes, its not the best Thai food but a great value for the money as compared to others in the 'hood.  I recommend it!
author: Mike D.

description: Second Thai lunch on Lombard with my colleagues and they brought me here, I was not disappointed. The cuisine was excellent, very tasty, and the flavors really enjoyable. I will get there again :)
author: Cedrick C.

description: authentic, inexpensive thai with smiling service.  what it lacks in ambiance, it makes up for in taste.  we've been a bunch of times and have never been disappointed...i recommend any of the curry dishes and the special rolls they sometimes have on their hand written menu.  can't remember the name of them, but i think they're pretty regular (possibly the "you & me rolls' others have talked about)...delicious.  wine selection is limited, but very reasonably priced.  all around very good!
author: Niki G.

description: I love thai food, so I'm a bit picky about which thai restaurants I go to. I really loved the two times I've been to Yukol Place--the food is very good! Especially the curry.
author: Nicole R.

description: A few friends and I ordered takeout from Yukol Place and I was extremely dissatisfied with the meal. I've lived in the city for 6 months and this was the worst food I've had since moving here! Cheap but the food is pretty terrible.
author: L B.

description: Whatever Yukol might lack in ambiance due to its unfortunate Lombard St. location, it more than makes up for with fantastic food and friendly, fast service. The dishes consistently combine fresh ingredients in great sweet and savory combinations, and I've always been impressed with the quality of meat in their dishes. I have never gone wrong trying one of their specials, either. Lastly, it's cheap, especially for a popular Marina place. Try everything.  I haven't been to Kwanjai, so I can't compare.  I'm all for competition, but Yukol is excellent enough that I don't need to dabble away.
author: jack r.

description: Minutes from the golden gate bridge, Yukol Place is located in the crappy motel section of lombard street.  America's Best Motel, The Travelodge and the Sea Captain inn are all just blocks away! More significantly, Yukol Place is also located on the same block as two other Thai eateries.  I have tried them all,and it is only yukol I have given my repeat business, as everything they have is quite delicious.  Try the tom ka gai and any of their Thai Curry offerings.
author: Mark K.

description: great thai food! i just went there the other day for lunch. the duck item on the lunch menu was super good. crispy skin, boneless meat, and awesome awesome sauce, served on a bed a spinach and cabbage that are perfectly cooked. my friend had the pad thai and it was super good too, well may be it's a bit on the oily side, but still, it was really yummy. sticky rice mango was also super good. not too much of the coconut milk sauce, and the mango was just really sweet. thai iced coffee was also superb, just the right amount coffee, milk and sugar. excellent service too. they keep my water glass filled, even after we give them the money and tips. everything was reasonably priced. i definitely recommend this place.
author: A K.
